Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellar_global
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel very good staff quite helping Rooms are OK AC was not working, they said April was winter time so AC not working, we opened windows to keep room little cool so that we could sleep otherwise OK hotel

Reviews.Title: “Vatican and beyond”
Reviews.Author: slorin721
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right around the corner from Vatican city and from the street (or depending which room you get) you have a view of St. Peters Basilica.. well part of it. Just a few min walk and you are at the Vatican. The hotel offers free wireless although only in 30 min intervalls and only in the lobby areas which we found to be a bit annoying. Breakfast is included and has an assortment of pastries and meats, eggs, juices and you can full your own pots of coffee. It was average food, not amazing but not bad. If you are venturing into the rest of Rome to see the other sites, it can be a nice stroll but bring your walking shoes. We walked everywhere in Rome, from one end of the city to the other. It allows you to see everything and really enjoy the culture but just remember that the hotel is on the east end of the city, not in the middle. That being said I did not have one issue with walking everywhere. Around the hotel are plenty of little stores, restaurants and gelatto places to go to. Its mainly smaller side streets where the hotel is. The staff were very friendly and you can book tours through them in which the tour will pick you up and drop you off (most pick you up and drop you off somewhere in the middle of the city but double check this depending on which tour you book). We took a tour to Pompeii which was amazing and well worth it. We were the first people to be picked up and the last to be dropped off though so it made for a long day since our hotel is outside the city on the other side of the river. The accomidations itself were nice. Don't expect spectacular but it was not dingy or drab either. It was average, clean and fine for our week long visit. Tip: From the airport you can take a 4 euro bus into the city. One company charges 6 EUR and the other 4 EUR, signes are posted everywhere and you can pay the driver when the bus comes or pay inside the airport. The bus will take you to Termini which is on the west end of the city, essentially the opposite side of Vatican city so you will need to trek all the way across the city to get to the hotel but if you don't mind a nice walk then you should go for it. If not, the area that the bus drops you off is right by a bus depot and you can take the bus towards the vatican or hop in a cab. On the way back to the airport we opted to take a Taxi which the hotel arrnaged for 47 Euro which included tip. If you have several people in your group and don't want to walk clear across the city this could be an option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonnym_7
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Starhotel in Naples we were not expecting much from this hotel, but it surprised us and was a pleasant stay overall due to its great location. We stayed at the Michelangelo for 4 nights, and I chose this hotel based on its mainly good reviews on tripadvisor and it's location to the Vatican. Before arrival I emailed the hotel to request a quiet and high floored room. Check in was quick and efficient and was greeted by a friendly chap on reception, who also gave us a good map for Rome and provided some tourist information. We were then taken to our room on the 7th floor, room 706. It was a lovely cosy room and seemed quiet as was not facing a road, and was at the back of the hotel. If you leaned out of the window you could see the Vatican. Old style 'box' tv with only 2 English speaking news channels, and no free wi fi in the room. Free wifi in the lobby area.  At night, with tv off etc, the quiet room I thought we had was not so quiet and as I'm a light sleeper, struggled to sleep that night as I could hear a constant hum and vibration from next door, which turns out to be ventilation. In the morning I explained about the noise, which reception are aware of, so they offered me another room to check out so we could change rooms, however the other room was in front of the lifts, on the 3rd floor (so close to the road) and had construction work going on in the rooms next to it, plus the room was not as good/nice as the one we had. I informed reception of this, so they showed me to another room which was exactly the same as the previous room they showed me but was on the 2nd floor, but still in front of lifts etc. So in the end just decided to stay in our room on the 7th floor as had some earplugs with me, and thank god I did. Really, at check in they should of notified me that the room may be a little noisy as they were aware of this when I complained about the noise. Breakfast was pretty average, no plastic cups like at the Starhotel Naples, but was pretty similar spread of hot and cold foods. Little bit better choice at this hotel, but you have to get your own tea/coffee which is rare at a 4 star hotel and I've never known that before. Staff were also pretty miserable. 3 members of staff faffing and wondering around, when only 1 needed for food replenishment etc and clearing tables, as you don't get shown to a table and they don't get you hot drinks. Location of this hotel is brilliant and is the best thing about the hotel. It cost €12 to get a taxi from the main train station to the hotel, and is located only 5 minutes walk from the Vatican. Plenty of local restaurants. We managed to walk from the Colosseum back to the hotel in just under an hour.  All in all an average hotel in a great location with good rooms depending on which one you get as the standard room we had was a lot nicer and cosier than the other standard rooms I had seen. Would have given 4 stars but due to noisy room and some miserable staff encounters, bring it down to 3 stars

Reviews.Title: “Right next to St. Peter's Basilica”
Reviews.Author: Rick F
Reviews.Content: If Vatican city was little bit bigger, this hotel would be part of Vatican city, that is how close this hotel is to St. Peter's Basilica. We could see St. Peter's Basilica from our window, and the view is so good, especially in the evening when the lights are on. When we went to visit vatican museum, we didn't need to get up early and rush ourselves, because we live so close it was so easy for us and we got into the museum really fast without much waiting at all. The hotel staff in the restaurant are so friendly, when I go for breakfast every morning they will give me a big smile and nice greetings. but hotel receptionists can be bit rude sometimes, I think they are just bit fed up of tourists. The breakfast choice are really good, lots of options for meat, bread, fruit and drinks. The hotel room are really spacious and clean, the bed was soft and big, one thing I like the most about the room is the bath room, it is really modern and clean, I've seen many hotel bath rooms, this is definitely a good one. The surrounding area of the hotel is really quiet and peaceful, totally opposite of the city centre in rome, there are few really nice little restaurants near this hotel with their italian charm, but not like most restaurants in the city centre area for tourists, they are proper italian food for local people, and the price are really reasonable. The only disadvantage about this would be it is far from the city centre and where most tourist attractions are, it usually take me 30-40 minutes to walk to the city centre area and my feet hurt so much when i get into the city, for the last few days i just decide to take taxi, which is much easier and enjoyable, but can be costly, depending on the traffic. So I recommend people who wants to spend lots of time in the city centre to find somewhere closer to live. Overall this hotel is really nice, and I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Vatican visitors”
Reviews.Author: photographersabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a family and had to get two rooms. The quarters felt a little tight and are somewhat older. Smaller and older rooms are more typical when travelling in Europe, especially if you are used to larger American hotel rooms and suites. This location was great since we were visiting the Vatican. The breakfast was nice and the staff was helpful. They recommended a restaurant nearby for dinner and they suggested we order the Artichoke Risotto, which was not on the menu. We did and it was one of the best things we ate the entire trip. I can’t recall the name of the restaurant, but it was only two blocks away; I would guess they recommend it often.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Hotel for our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Hani E
Reviews.Content: We researched for nearly 4 months before purchasing our vacation. We narrowed it down to a few hotels, but we were so so so so happy and delighted with our choice. This hotel is everything people say it is plus more! The Location of this hotel is litterally about 100 yards from St. Peters Square. Right around the corner from the metro, and all bus lines. The hotel itself is very clean, and has a boutique hotel feel to it. The staff was very helpful, and very nice. We were lucky to have a room with a balcony, that had a view of St. Peters Dome. The hotel is located right off of a main st, that has lots of restaurants, and banking centers nearby. The breakfast buffet was really good. Fresh juices and eggs, bacon, sausage, and a bunch of different cereals and foods. Our trip to ROMA was the best trip I have ever taken. and the hotel had a big part to do with it. :))))

Reviews.Title: “starhotels michelangelo roma”
Reviews.Author: vallor1974
Reviews.Content: I'm usually skeptic about big brand chain hotels, since hospitality is standardized and set for a large panel of guests. Nothing extraordinary or remarkable, usually. This is not true for Michelangelo Hotel. Ok, what does really matters in hospitality industry? Position, position, position! As a great and famous italian Hotel Manager used to repeat at hospitality conventions. But not only that. Friendly and efficient staff at reception. Everything sounds easy and automatic with those guys. Rome is not so chaotic and polluted by thousands of screaming tourists in this part of Rome. And we are talking about a place something like 200 mt from Vatican City! You have a great breakfast and step out from the lobby for a ten minutes walk, just to have a look to Bernini Masterpiece in Vatican City. Then, go further to Castelsantangelo Bridge and walk randomly along the old part of Rome. That's the best way to enjoy real Rome, avoiding normal touristic routes. In the afternoon, come back to your hotel, take a sit at the bar and enjoy a drink together to your girlfriend, or your friends. The bartender is friendly and talkative, leading you to take your time and relax for a while, waiting for dinner time. Nice place. Well trained staff. Best Position for cultural and art-inspired holidays. Room spotless cleaned; bathroom larger than I expected from the pictures on the web. If you really care about value for money, with no frills, that's your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet spot close to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: julianandkim
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been happier with the position .......our room backed onto a lane that was quite noisy early due to a Greengrocer stocking up each day .As with most hotels we have found in Europe the heating was oppressive but here you could open the windows to cool,down .breakast was fantastic too

Reviews.Title: “Location good for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Stargazer1167
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November. The hotel itself is lovely, the rooms etc.. are very clean. The breakfasts were nice but we were a bit fed up of Bacon and Scrambled egg by the end!! We didn't eat in the hotel as the prices were a bit prohibitive in the restaurant. We went to the bar for a drink on the first night - €18 for two Bailey's - needless to say we didn't go there again!!! The staff were just on the right side of polite but not very friendly or patient. The location is excellent for the Vatican and also for getting to the Vatican stop for any of the Hop on Hop off tours. (Don't let the Hotel sell you tickets for the GreenLine Tours, they are terrible and way overpriced for what you get. Walk through St Peter's Square to Villa della Conciliazone, you can pick up any of the tours there. The Castel sant Angelo is within walking distance and is a nice walk in the evening when it's getting dark. You can get some lovely photos along the river from any of the Bridges down there.) All in all We found the hotel to be comfortable and clean. What more do you want for a holiday in Rome I guess but it would be nice if having a drink in the bar or dinner in the hotel were affordable and the staff were a bit friendlier. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and were able to get my pyjamas back when they were sent out to the laundry by mistake!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: azzure
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff was mostly very courteous and helpful (one older gentleman, named Claudio, was a little gruff and condescending). Our room was not luxurious, and had no particular view, but was clean and comfortable. The breakfast which was included in our room rate was wonderful, with eggs, bacon, and all kinds of fruit, bread and pastries. But the best feature of this hotel is its location. The neighborhood is quiet compared to others in the heart of Rome, and the Vatican is five minutes away. Furthermore, the rest of Rome is easily accessible by public bus; the bus stops were right around the corner and and staff was knowledgeable about which buses to take. (#64 will take you to most popular sites in the city, and #571 goes right to the Colosseum.) It's true that the Metro station is some distance away, but buses are far and away the better choice for transportation within Rome. We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - close to the Vatican but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon511
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights during our honeymoon in August 2011. We were in Italy and Greece for just over two weeks and this was our least favorite hotel. The room was OK by Rome standards I suppose (think Holiday Inn). Location Pros: Amazingly close to the Vatican. It was really nice to get an early start on the day we spent at the Vatican. We also loved walking to Trastavere for dinner and it wasn't that far. Location Cons: It is *NOT* close to anything else. The buses seemed to run once every 30 minutes if you're lucky so we just walked to everything. It's quite a hike from the Vatican to the Colosseum in the heat of August. The walk also has you go through a pretty long tunnel. It's not the most pleasant walk. The hotel does offer a complimentary breakfast (fruit + dry pastries + coffee). It was nothing special. We probably went two out of four mornings. My biggest advice on finding a hotel in Rome is to find a hotel close to where you expect to be going. This hotel was so far that it felt like most of our days were designed around walking back and forth. We'd head out in the morning to tour for a bit, come back to clean up (it's really hot in August!), then head back out again for dinner and drinks. It made for a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad not great next I would look for a more convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: So I'm in the fence with this hotel. I will explain the way I rated the different categories. OVERALL-AVERAGE.... My opinion not bad not great close to Vatican city but my main gripe was We could here people in other rooms crystal clear. We opened our door a few times thinking people were being loud in the hallway but we were hearing them through the duct work. So I don't know if the duct work was not connected or since the ac unit didn't work maybe the unit was removed but that was a problem for me. CLEANLINESS-EXCELLENT the place was clean no complaints. LOCATION-AVERAGE...very close to Vatican city maybe 5 min walk but everything else you need to take the metro which the closest metro station is on the other side of vatican city not very convenient. Easiest way would be get on a hop on hop off bus tour at the Vatican city see all the sights then return back to the Vatican stop and walk to the hotel. ROOMS-AVERAGE...hearing people in other rooms annoyed me other than that nothing wrong with the rooms. SERVICE-AVERAGE...I've had better and I've had way worse ....service was not a issue for me here at all. VALUE-AVERAGE we booked our trip through Costco so I don't know the individual prices but I cant imagine it was a killer deal or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Fail”
Reviews.Author: Tlabranche
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel has the worst staff I have ever seen in a hotel. When I asked the staff about driving down to the Almafi Coast, rather than getting the answer I was seeking; I got a lecture about how foolish tourists drive there all the time and find trouble. The cleanliness of the rooms was not very good. Internet is pricey Considering what you pay for the room to begin with. The worst part of my stay came when it was time to check out. If you have a rental car, you will have to pay $20 euro daily. What they won't tell you at check in is that the garage is cash only. At four in the morning, the desk agent literally wanted me to walk into foreign neighborhood and find an ATM. He would not release my car keys until I paid cash. After arguing with him for several minutes, he reluctalntly accepted a credit card. If I ever go back to Rome, I won't stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: CJ124
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience but a way from the main city and close to Vatican so from exploring city its a bit far. But all said and done good and most important value for money hotel. Good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to many restaurants and St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: WaTerBaBy58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It's close to many neighborhood restaurants and shops and within a couple of blocks of St. Peter's Cathedral. I could step out on my small balcony and see the dome of St. Peter's so clearly. The hotel had nice decor, a small bar area, decent breakfast buffet and a large lobby. It was very nice for a tour group, but if I was travelling on my own, I would probably pick a hotel that was a little newer with bigger rooms. The rooms weren't tiny by any means, just normal European sized. I prefer a slightly larger room. The housekeeping was excellent and the front desk staff were both friendly and multilingual.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Patty R
Reviews.Content: I totally recomend this hotel, I was so happy with everything the room, the staff super friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast, and gread location, we walk to everywhere. overall I think was the best hotel in our 3 week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: eseliv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Vatican City. it's a good hotel for the price, clean with professinal staff and good rooms. They have their own transport to aiportfor a reasonable price, which is better than a taxi in my opinion. My the only complain about the hotel is Wi-Fi. First of all it works only in the lobby but only 30 minutes is free. You need to ask for a password and they give you a page with password but only once. After you used up your 30 min you'll have to pay for the Internet. And it looked like they had limited amount of traffic for free Wi-Fi, it you came late you might not get it al all. Very strange for such a big hotel. So if you plan ahead and don't need to use Internet for planning your next day it's a pretty decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value, very good location”
Reviews.Author: michealCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Staff are friendly. The breakfast is very good with a wide selection of hot and cold meats, cheeses, fruit etc.The rooms are a decent size and clean but could do with some redecoration. The air con is noisy and not very efficient. The bathroom is poorly laid out. The facilities in the room are very basic. The location is excellent, a few mins from St Peters, bus stop 100m away and a train station 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel close to St. Peter's Square”
Reviews.Author: Jaimekelowna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights September 30 - October 3rd, 2011. BOOKING - My parents booked a standard room online, and we paid about +$100 extra per night for an upgraded superior room. The only difference really was that our room had hardwood floors/2nd floor/one queen bed and their's had carpetted floors/4th floor/twin beds. Not really worth the extra money for the upgrade. We had emailed the hotel directly ahead of time and request balcony rooms/non-smoking, so this was helpful. Also, (through prior email contact) the hotel arranged a direct pick-up from the airport for us. The driver was waiting with a sign. He had a larger Mercedes mini-van that was comfortable and convenient. $65 Euros for 4-people . ROOMS - The bed was comfortable (by European standards), plus the hotel has a pillow menu. No rock hard european pillows if you don't want them! Also, had a mini-bar, A/C, balcony, safe and typical smaller bathroom with bidet. Bring your electrical converters. FOOD - The hotel serves a great buffet breakfast with hot and cold items, plus all the cappucino you can drink. Claudio who runs the lounge/bar was very friendly and attentive. A great spot for your pre-dinner cocktail. There were two excellent restaurants just a few blocks away that we enjoyed. (Go right out hotel lobby, up 2 blocks then turn left.) One is a seafood restaurant and the other is traditional Roman (La Frusta). The owner Pietro was outstanding and friendly. LOCATION - The location is fine. Only one block to the buses, one block to the San Pietro train station and about a 5-minute walk right to the centre of St. Peter's Square, or hop-on/off buses. It is not close to the Metro however, but we didn't find this a problem this time, even though we had previously stayed in the Termini area. STAFF - most of the staff was very friendly and spoke good English. There is definitely one male staff member that has an ego problem, and probably should not be working the front lines, however, everyone else was helpful & friendly. INTERNET - I had my iPad and had no problem with the lobby connection. Again, you're in another country so it's always a bit slower. When I used up the 30-mins, I just grabbed a new sheet with a new login code. Big deal. Besides ...... you're in Rome. Go enjoy the sites and get off the computer! Overall a good hotel. It is used by several of the major tour operators/companies, as we saw a few tours coming and going during our 3-night stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZSteelers
Reviews.Content: pretty good hotel... Nice size for italian hotels but the staff are somewhat rude and for how unfriendly they can be they expdct you to be very well-mannered . Also, 30 minutes of internet per room per day in the lobby is dumb. No matter how many people you have, there is only 30 minutes allowed and they can run out of internet vouchers... Just be aware of this. Really close to the Vatican and not too far from other things. Definitely need a taxi to the trai station for around 20€ and airport is about 35€ per person via shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but do not come here if you need internet”
Reviews.Author: StarEye2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just behind St. Peter square. A great location for visiting the Vatican. The Internet connection offered is a shame. Very slow most of the time and impossible to use at peak hours. It's free in the lobby but you get charged 11.5€ per day in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as offered. Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ana M
Reviews.Content: When you go Europe is pretty different than the USA. Hotels in the other side of the Atlantic are more costs cutting since services are more expensive. Do not expect big rooms, big restrooms or new furniture. However, this Hotel deserves a A+. I paid around 180 US$ per night. The room was pretty clean, the balcony has a great view to Saint Peter Catedral at The Vatican City. The mini Bar was full of different type of refresments and snacks. The Internet service has different options. You have free WIFI at the looby or pay 15 US$ in your room. Breakfast was very good specially the pastries and no complaint about the coffee. For only 8 US$ they take the Breakfast to your room with unlimited pastries and coffee, egs, etc. The service at the Front desk was very good, fast and very useful to know where the best attrations of Rome are. I got to send some documents scanned to my office in Mexico and I found its modest biz center was small but, allow me to surf, print and Sylvia at the front Desk scaned and send those on my behalf. Great team; 10 minutes walk from Saint Peter. thank you for your attentions: Enio, Sylvia, Daniel, Francesca, the people in the kitchen and the rest of the team. For sure will go back if need to go Rome again. Angel Moran +++ Mexico City

Reviews.Title: “Starhotel Michaelangelo Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: beejmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Michaelangelo to start our 11 day vacation in Italy. The taxi ride with 2 other couples from the airport took 45 mins and cost 20 euros each. The driver was happy when I gave him 45 euros. We reserved a junior suite but received a regular suite. Luckily we were able to check in at 11:30 am. The suite is large for European standards. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from St. Pete's square & the dome of the Cathredral is visible from the front of the hotel. We were concerned about how far it was to walk over the bridge to Rome. We quickly found 2 bridges in front of the St. Angelo's castle (10 mins to bridge of Tibre River). Every day we walked through the square and Vatican City to get to the bridge (very nice stroll). There are restaurants close to the hotel but Vatican City is very quiet at night compared to Rome. The hotel provided a complementary buffet breakfast each morning which consisted of eggs, bacon, sausages, cheese, fruit, yogurt, salad, and lots of pastries. The front desk staff varied from grumpy older gentlemen who seemed bothered to answer a question, to friendly younger staffers. Everyone spoke English and seemed amused at my attempts to speak a few words of Italian. There is a bar off of the lobby but never seemed occupied. The bartender also seemed bothered to fetch 2 glasses of wine. There is no ice machine in the hotel and the bartender reluctantly gave me 2 glasses to take up to the room. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotels cleanliness, staff & location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: Minnish
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on my first trip to Rome. Arrived late and the night porter took my bags to my room and explaind the dining times and bar times. My room was a very good size with huge double bed, 2 chairs and coffee table, bathroom was quite adequate and shower had good pressure. Room also had a balcony which I could see the St. peters bacilica from. Hotel was only 2 minutes from St Peters and just a few more minutes to the Vatican Museum and Sistien Chaple. Lots of shops and everyone spoke enough Englaish that I could get by. Staff at the Hotel were very helpful, provided a map of Rome and advise on things to see. Breakfast was a good selection of continental and cooked, ate Dinner on 2 nights, both time very good, again staff were friendly and service was faultless. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, both for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay for a pilgrimage”
Reviews.Author: Catholic_Pilgrim10
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece, and I just returned from a pilgrimage in Rome and Assisi. The hotel is less than a 10-minute from St. Peter's and you pass by a large water fountain from which to fill your water bottles with pure, clean water from the acquifiers. Visits to churches may be reached by walking. The bus and the Metro stops are nearby. If you want a Roma Pass (good for 3 days) you better purchase early in the morning as all were sold out by 9:30 or 10:00 when we wanted to buy ours. We had a junior suite that had a double bed in the bedroom and a double sofa bed in the living room. Breakfast was tasty - lots of fresh fruit - and Julia the hostess is very friendly and speaks English as did our waitress each day. One day fresh-squeezed blood orange juice was served on the buffet. We found the staff to be pleasant and had no problems whatsoever. We usually ate lunch somewhere else in Rome and dinner at several restaurants near the Michelangelo. The lobby could use some updating, I'll admit. If you don't have your own computer, the hotel charges $75 for a 30-minute time period to download and print boarding passes for your flight home; otherwise it's free. We used the hotel's transit service to be picked up and taken back to FCO airport and it was worth the money for the thrill ride of our lives in Roman traffic. Don't let the erratic scooters scare you as they zip in and around you. Sitting in the front seat is not a wise thing to do, as I learned. When I return to Rome, I'll definitely stay at the Michelangelo because it is very convenient for what we wanted to accomplish.

Reviews.Title: “Would give 3 1/2 stars if I could”
Reviews.Author: Jillef
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days and chose it due to location near Vatican City. Rooms were ok, breakfast buffet was ok. Lobby is nice and the free Wi-Fi is great. Front desk staff were ok, could have been friendlier and I would have appreciated more help locating a good restaurant nearby instead of being told "they are all good". One word of caution: we were ripped off a few times by taxis from airport and to train station since we had 5 people and lots of luggage. It might be cheaper to divide into 2 taxis next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ROME”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyG_1974
Reviews.Content: The view of St Peter's had as hooked from the second we stepped out of the taxi (could not travel by train as the Metro service was on strike - again). They were able to assist with an early check-in and room though small was gorgeous! The hotel is quiet and clean and the location 'around the corner' from the Vatican was perfect. On the breakfast side - the coffee was strong and the pasties were yummy! All the staff spoke excellent English and were able to assist with all our queries. There are two restaurants around the corner from the hotel that you have to try - the food was sublime!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, a little dated. Did not meet my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: msu2001la
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of a two week trip through Italy. The location is very close to the Vatican, but is otherwise a difficult area for walking to tourist sites. The nearest Metro station is the Vatican stop, which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. If you stay here for several days it would be worth your time to figure out the bus lines to get around. The hotel is nice, but a little dated and showing some wear. Based on their website I was expecting a new/modern hotel and was surprised when we arrived to find something more dated and tired looking. While I was happy with our free upgrade to a junior suite (which we neither asked for nor expected) the bed in our room was uncomfortable (very lumpy and worn mattress). We could hear water running through the pipes in the walls every time a room above us used their bathroom. The hallway carpets are a little dingy and worn, there were some stains on the wall, etc. The breakfast buffet was a bit disappointing. Other hotels offer a variety of fresh fruit and things here were more of the canned peaches/pears variety. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends. For the price, you can find something much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: Tina661
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a very small room for three of us. The room was clean enough but very small for the price we paid. The reception staff was rude most of the time. The very first day we went touring in the city and our laptop was stolen out of our room. We were told that if we filed a police report the hotel insurance company would take care of the loss. We went to the police and filed a report and turned it into the manager of the hotel. It has been almost two months now. I have contacted the hotel several times and spoken to various people and left messages but no-one calls back and their insurance has not reimbursed us for the loss. We can't even get anyone to return a phone call to explain what is happening. I have read a lot of the trip advisor reports and there seems to be quite a few thefts from rooms at this hotel and the management does nothing about it. We did file the requisite police report to get reimbursement but have received no such reimbursement. Do not stay at this hotel if you have anything valuable you plan to leave in your room. Don't leave laptops, ipods, phones or anything in your room because it will be stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mac1CrieffScotland
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 7 nights in Rome, staying here.We found the hotel very clean, bedroom with plenty of room, staff helpful and breakfast plentiful and with a variety of choice. Our bed linen and towels were changed daily, great, given the humidity in Rome. The bar prices were ridiculous but just don't drink there. There are good eating places nearby particularly "Perdincibacco". Step out the door and there is St Peter's, beautiful at night. Our 1 gripe was that when we were there, there was a strike and the hotel could have displayed a notice advising us of this. The hotel is very close to the Vatican and the no.64 bus, which is very easy to use, takes you in to the Ancient City. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, somewhat lacking on facilities”
Reviews.Author: florencereally
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location near the Vatican. The rooms are rather ugly in that manner that 4 star hotels have a habit of being, breakfast is very poor for the money, (again something that seems to be a rule at 4 star hotels in Italy) the staff at the desk were often quite unhelpful (something that was a recurring theme on this trip to Italy, sadly), facilities were poor - we had to work very hard to get my boyfriend's shirt ironed for a wedding that we were attending, although eventually after hard negotiation this miraculously became possible for a fee of 3 euros. Generally ok, but not fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not that great either”
Reviews.Author: Spoz_of_Oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and were initially thrilled by the location and service. We soon worked out that all was not as good as we thought. Although the hotel is technically close to a train station, it is the regional train station which does not take you into the main city. The fact that it was next to the Vatican was a selling point for us, but after you see it on the first day, you realise that everything else is actually far away. If we ever return back to Rome we would stay at a place that was close to a Metro station (not a regional one) which is the main service that runs through the city and can get you to almost all the major tourist spots. The staff is very polite and friendly, however we were often recommended and pointed to use services which they were obviously partnered with. The tourist bus service they offered was both more expensive and less frequent than the one we found (and ended up using) from the souvenir store around the corner. Upon leaving they recommended that we use their limousine service to get to the airport citing that the taxi might over charge us and that the train would be very expensive. We soon worked out that by law, a taxi can only charge 40 Euros maximum and that the train was only 8 Euros (much less than they cited). We ended up taking the train and saved ALOT of money compared to their service. The buffet breakfast was quite sub-standard. Although it had the standard servings of bacon and eggs, bread etc, I have never met a place where I declined a serving of bacon before - it was just very poor tasting. By the 3rd day I stopped eating them and stuck to cereal. Food outside is much cheaper and much more tasty. Lastly, the towels we had in our room had dark stains on them. To be fair there were good things about the hotel. Free wifi is a godsend (altho you do have to re-get a voucher every 30 mins from the concierge). The room was very clean. As mentioned, the staff are generally helpful and polite. Location wise, it's close to a small grocery store, a pharmacy and some really nice restaurants - i got sick so the pharmacy was needed! If you intend to use the tourist/public bus (which you will definitely need as the train station is useless), the San Pietro stop is a major stop that all the tourist buses and public buses run through which is really convenient. The room aircon was fantastic - and especially needed as temps hit the 40C mark! Overall, mainly due to location I would stay somewhere else next time. And i'd settle for no included breakfast and choose to eat outside as that would be both cheaper and tastier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: NilsRuneHjelle
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great breakfast with friendly staff in the restaurant. The lunch and dinners are quite expensive, but you get what you pay for. My impression is that few of the hotel guests eat there. My only problem with this hotel is the wifi solution they have gone with. In order to get wifi in your room you have to pay 5€ for 24h. This is 2011 and in my opinion wifi sould be included in the room rate (or free if you will). The wifi is free in the lobby, but you have to get a new username and password every 30 minutes from the front desk and the speeds are on 1990s level. I share others experience that the front desk staff arent very service oriented, but the rest of the staff are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not where you expected but just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mcruz44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on a small side street behind the Vatican and St Peter's Basilica. It was a small hotel with all the necessary amenities. It doesn't look like much from outside, but it had a beautiful view of St. Peter's Basilica's Dome. Beautiful, especially at night! The hotel still uses an actual key on a heavy metal tassel for your room which you drop off at the front desk when you go out. (didn't delay us at all when you came back). Breakfast had a beautiful and tasty breakfast. Service at the dining room and front desk was very nice. The beds and pillows were comfy and the bathroom was roomy. The room was not as small as i thought it would be, it was just right for two people. The dinner menus appeared to be a bit on the expensive side, so we walked up the street to the main avenue and around the corner (to the right) to La Pilotta. A small eatery owned by Mario. Great food for a great price. We then would walk to the Vatican (a 5 minute walk. The other sites were a bit further away, but within a quick cab ride away). Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: blmtct
Reviews.Content: We were a family of three and our room was nice and clean. We had two twin beds together and a rollaway bed for our 11 yr old son which was comfortable. Bathroom was good but you do have to maneuver arount the sink, toilet and bidet. This is something you have to expect in Europe. The breakfast included was very good. Variety of meats, cheeses, bread, cereals, fruits and yogurt. Free 1/2 hour of internet in the lobby only of hotel. We walked a few blocks and we were at the Vatican. As read in previous tips just around the corner from the hotel is a fantastic gelato stand "Captain Cono" delicious ice cream and plenty of places to eat near this hotel. I would recommend it and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Would come back”
Reviews.Author: nikitatime1921
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. As they say, location, location, location..Vatican was outside of our hotel down the street like 5 min. Amazing. Good rooms, decent air conditioning. Beds were a little hard but typical European beds. Nice bathrooms and clean. I would stay here again. Only 30 min free wifi per person. But if you go back a few hours later and ask for another code, they would give you one!

Reviews.Title: “STAFF = LIARS!!! DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: dijashaikh
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE I forgot a small jewelry pouch, called immediately after I left, was told that no one had even gone in the room to clean yet the pouch was no where to be found. They then started accusing me telling me it was my fault I left it and that it was in my luggage and not with them--- LIES..... I called every day I was out of Rome to talk to the manager who was always out and I was told I needed to make an appointment just to speak to him .... RIGHTTTTT I got back to Rome and went to discuss the incident with them when I was verbally attacked by the staff, I was appalled --- they were screaming at me in the lobby --- I was crying as all my jewelry in the pouch was my great grandmothers --- no sympathy --- they were all in it together told me to go to the police but that I would not get anything out of it since they DIDNT steal it and would not compensate me, called me a stupid tourist and said that the second I check out they have no responsibility to any items left in the room. I was shocked at the way they were talking to me and the way they had so obviously stolen my box and had zero remorse... DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: trav-go
Reviews.Content: Terrific stay at Starhotels Michelangelo. We booked a package through Costco that included hotel, transfers, breakfast, transportation, even wine for a great price. Our room was very nicely furnished and included a sitting area with sofa and cocktail table. The free breakfast was OUTSTANDING with fresh fruit, bakery items, eggs, cheese, sausage and more -- better than any complimentary breakfast I've experienced in a US hotel. Helpful staff at the front desk. However, when asking for restaurant recommendations the front desk will always steer you towards establishments that give the hotel a kick-back. Location is a 10-minute walk to the Vatican and about a mile from ancient Rome sites. Overall, a great stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JessEdgar99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after a 11 night Costa Cruise. We were very much looking forward to it as we had been highly impressed with the hotel we stayed at prior to the cruise that was further out from site of Rome. The location of the hotel was a quick walk away from the vatican and many other sites we wanted to see, which was very nice. We also very impressed with most of the staff at this hotel and they were even able to get us into our room hours before check-in time, which made us very happy! However, this hotel needs some major updating. The room we were in looked liked the bathroom had been updated recently but the rest of the room did not and it appared to grungy with black marks on the wall and the carpet just looked like it need a good bath. We were also disappointed that the rooms didn't not have free wi-fi in it as we were ready to catch up with our family as we had been out of pocket for almost two weeks. But were happy when we found out that we could go down to the lobby and access the Wi-Fi for free, even if it was a little inconvient. All in all this a great hotel for the money if you want to stay in the city walls and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “4STARS and THE BEST LASAGNA EVER..NO RICOTTA CHEESE”
Reviews.Author: debra1711
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for a special pilgrimage with 52 other people.we had mass with the pope.We stayed at starhotels michelangelo..THE LASAGNA THERE IS TO DIE FOR..no ricotta cheese..Just soft firm noodles fresh small amount of sausage a white sauce with parmesean and mozzarella cheese..The white sauce did have a tint of red tomato suace in it also..THIS MELTS IN OUR MOUTH,I went with PETERS WAY TOUR GROUP..I WILL COME BACK FOR THE POPE,FOR ROME,,,AND FOR THAT LASAGNA..OMG..GOOD debra shea

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SMI1957
Reviews.Content: We arrived from london to rome on 6 june 2011. got done by the white taxi. paid 45 euros. took half an hour to reach our hotel. Then the fun began! We were told at the desk that 2 of the rooms had been vandalised by some idiots so therefore we could not have our 2 double standard rooms. We were offered a suite whereby our 21yr old son had to sleep on a double sofa bed in the lounge. There was a tiny bathroom. Not ideal really! So we refused. My wife and I were given a spacious double standard room which was very nice and clean and a room with a view. Our son had a tiny room with a double bed and he was not a happy boy. After much complain and to expedia who we had booked our holiday with, on the third day our son was given a room opposite us. now we were all happy. The hotel was excellent, breakfast was good, as you normally get luke warm tea, we asked for hot milk and had lovely hot tea. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel even though we had this problem to no fault of the hotel. Ideal location for the vatican and the bus service to centre of rome. Pizza restaurents and must try their icecreams. We had a lovely time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: CaAngie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 days from May 18-20. We had a quiet room in the back area of the hotel on the 7th floor. The room was small but had a comfotable bed, refrigerator, flat screen TV, and nice marble bathroom with complimentary robe and slippers. The staff were polite and helpful and the lobby was very nice with a bar area. The breakfast area was also very nice, and had an assortment of breads, pastries, cold cuts, and some hot food. There is a small family store a couple doors down if you want to purchase water, drinks, fruit, olives, etc. There are some restaurants around the corner if you want to eat close by. Also, the bus stop is only about a block away. Bus 64 will get you to the Rome Termini. This is a good hotel if you want to stay close to the Vatican. It's about a ten minute walk. However, there is not a lot of nightlife here. If you want to be in a more upbeat area, stay around the Pantheon or Trevi fountain area. We ended up eating around the Pantheon area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quality staff, clean rooms, great breakfast - you need more?”
Reviews.Author: WhitIV
Reviews.Content: Our group of 14 stayed here for several days in late May, before a 10-day cruise, and another day after that cruise in June. When we came back in June, one of our group commented "It feels like we're back home!" I agree. There is something to be said for a hotel almost literally within the shadow of the dome of St. Peter's. This was the first trip to Europe for most of our group. That means all the issues associated with first-time visitors can and did come up. For example, the airline lost my wife's and my luggage for over 24 hours. The hotel staff assured us that, were our luggage to arrive while we were out, it would be delivered to our room. Front desk staff told us where to buy the necessities until our luggage arrived. When we went out that first day, they offered to and did continue calling the airline lost luggage service until our luggage was found and arrived. When we asked the front desk to break a 100 euro note, the man handed me scissors before providing me change, smilingly. We always found the front desk staff friendly, accommodating, and multi-lingual. We always received our faxes with a smile. We got directions, including what buses to take, to get to our destinations. They called taxis for us too. All around, a very good experience. Our travel package included breakfast at the hotel, and what a breakfast we had every morning! Hot and cold, juices, italian meats; the buffet was complete and delicious. They even provided freshly made espresso upon request. We were always greeted with a big smile and elegant service. Taking into account that it was a buffet, we were all impressed. Having stayed at the hotel on two separate occasions with a large group, we had experience with several rooms. Some rooms were more modern and roomy than others, but all were meticulously clean. The hotel has a full restaurant and bar. I'm not aware that any of us had dinner at the hotel, as the hotel has numerous very good restaurants nearby, including La Vittoria, recommended by the front desk, and my one of my favorite restaurant's anywhere, I Quattro Miro, which is a "Do Not Miss!" We had no problem finding good gelato in the neighborhood on our many walks. I believe all of our group would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone, and would gladly return there on our next trip to Rome. Note to internet users: the hotel offers 30 minutes of free internet wi-fi in the lobby. More time with hotel-wide coverage is offered at extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no Customer Service to be found here! Go Somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: CoastrMom
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Costco Travel for two nights before out Mediterranean cruise. Our Jr Suite was not ready when we arrived and after flying all night, this is a must! The front desk (the men) were so rude and short it was ridiculous. We checked into our Jr Suite and the noteboard on the counter said that if you have a Suite or Jr Suite, there was free internet access. While we were completing our check in, my daughter asked for the access code so that she would use it and they provided her with a 24 hour access code. Imagine my surprise when they charged me $11 Euros for her access. Their excuse was that she didn't ask for the "Free Internet Access". Are you kidding me?!? We were checking in and they were well aware of our room type. A guy from Texas had just checked into a Jr Suite before me. While I was checking out he overheard my discussion regarding the bill. He was there on Vatican business and they told him that his internet access was $25 Euros for 24 hours. I wasted no time in showing him the noteboard and that it should be free. At least that is one person that they will not gouge. Aside from the front desk situation, the room was nice and the maids were very friendly. It had very nice bathroom facilities. The restaurant was quite overpriced and the waiter kept ignoring us throughout the meal. It was almost like they had a disdain for foreigners. Couldn't figure it out. The view from out front of the hotel was great. Made a wonderful photo. Upon our return from our cruise, we stayed at the Rome Cavelleri. What a big difference in every sense of the word. No matter what they offer you, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Blunt attitude”
Reviews.Author: alan_clementson
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good rooms and food but the attitude of the reception staff was a let down, Very blunt and short with their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: skinnerbox8
Reviews.Content: PROS: Very near the Vatican. You can even see it outside your room's balcony. Excellent staff. Very kind and always ready to assist. Great beds - not too soft. Bathroom space is good. Not cramped at all compared to most hotels in Europe. Shower excellent. Rooms are obviously well-maintained. Good restaurants are about 2 blocks away - a short walk CONS: Breakfast has very limited selection. Room keys: No keycards, but traditional keys with heavy, heavy bell design attached to it. Hassle to bring outside while on tour. Leave it at the front desk. Expensive internet. 5 euro for 1 hour, 11 for 24 hours. Not worth it. But overall, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Retreat in a Busy City”
Reviews.Author: SwissSushi
Reviews.Content: My Mom chose this hotel because of the location and the advertised Star beds. Last time we were in Europe, we were unimpressed by the excessive firmness of European beds. The beds were her big selling point. Upon arrival, we were promptly and courteously greeted and checked in. The process was rapid and easy. Given we were VERY tired, that was great. The room was a good size, especially for Rome. We booked thru Costco and it was described as a Superior room. It did face the street, so there was some noise, but nothing some ear plugs did not fix for me. There was a balcony, which was nice as well. The fixtures were not necessarily luxurious, but there was ample closet and drawer space for two women who pack heavy. The bathroom was the best feature, if you ask me. The tub was PERFECT for soaking your tired legs and feet. I miss it, now that we have moved on to another city. Another thing we enjoyed was the electric kettle. We both enjoy tea and being able to make our own cup was great. Housekeeping was courteous and thorough. I really was pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms. As for the bed, well it was OK. I would not call it pillow soft, nor would I say it was like a board. I guess it is best to say it was the most comfortable bed I have slept in during any of my European stays. One helpful thing to know is that the front desk will exchange your money without a commission. The rates are pretty close to the current currency rates for the day. For tech junkies like me, be advised that this hotel DOES NOT have free internet in the rooms. You can get a 128K connection for 30 minutes for free in the lobby, if you like, but ewwww. You won't like. The fee for 24 hours was 11.50 Euros and 54.50 Euros got you 7 days. Yikes! Lastly, the location is nice. I enjoyed exploring the working class neighborhood that surrounds it. I found a lovely bakery and small grocery around the corner. It was perfect to pop in and get a bottle of water or a box of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: London9000
Reviews.Content: Great location for the vatican, but a little outside the historic Centre. For a european city centre hotel, the rooms are a decent size, bed good, breakfast good. Its not 5 star luxury, but it is very good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chuck_F65
Reviews.Content: The Starhotel Michelangelo hotel is very close to the Vatican with a view from the street of St. Peters dome. Despite its proximity to the Vatican it is not located an excessively touristy area, and is close to a few reasonably priced restaurants and local grocery stores. The nearest subway station is a brisk 20 minute walk. The hotel staff is courteous and helpful. Breakfast in the morning is generally quite good with a good selection of hot and cold food. Free internet wireless is available only in the lobby and only after obtaining a 30 minute voucher (for free) from the desk, which frankly I found to be irritating. Our first room was on the street side which we found to be very noisy. The front desk was able to change our room to the back of the hotel which made us happy campers. The hotel has a restaurant, but best we can determine it has very few customers at night, other than tour groups. Having stayed at a number of hotels in Rome, this hotel is better than most in the reasonable price range, and we will certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: MissAnd123
Reviews.Content: We had a Superior room, with breakfast included. The superior room lived up to its name. Our room was lovely - well appointed, furnishings comfortable to the point of luxury (gorgeous red and gold brocades a feature). The bathroom was wonderful, all black and white tiles and marble accents, fluffy towels and cosy robes. Everything was clean and of good quality; it was a great room to come back to and relax in after a busy day/night exploring. The breakfast was a business-buffet, but at the better end of this kind of meal - a good value way to prepare for an active day. Insider's tip: if you want real coffee, ask for Italian-style espresso in whatever mode you prefer (cafe latte, etc.), otherwise they'll bring you nasty US-style filter coffee (perhaps in deference to the international guests?) The service was friendly and helpful, despite the front desk being constantly busy. Location-wise, the hotel was just a few handy blocks from the Vatican, and thus a short bus trip/taxi or achieveable walk from many other attractions in Rome. Standing outside the front entrance, the dome of St Peter's dominates the skyline.

Reviews.Title: “A very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: riversidevoyager
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it was staying in this hotel. The room was fabulous, the staff at the desk & the restaurant were friendly, and the food was great. The close proximity to the Vatican was a plus also. I would recommend this place to anyone considering a trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stephenmccallister
Reviews.Content: The Michelangelo was our base for a week in Rome on a singing/sightseeing tour. Always helpful, the desk staff was very proper until you got to know them, then they were quite friendly as well. The lobby and adjoining dining room were well appointed and quite comfortable, as was the bar, albeit a little pricey for local beer. Wait Staff in the Bar and Dining Room were uniformly friendly. The breakfast buffet was very large, well prepared, and included anything you could possibly want except grits. It was replenished as stocks ran down too. Our particular room was certainly adequate, but had not been updated as some on the same floor had been. The bathroom was spotless although the European shower took some getting used to. Every other room on the street side, at least, had a balconey: those in between did not. The trick of a single room key with the big tassel was quaint. A fresh fruit and veggie shop was just down the street, and within a few blocks were multiple little restaurants, pizza-by-the-slice and Gelato stands, including Kapitan Cono.

Reviews.Title: “no problems great location”
Reviews.Author: sherlockmichael7
Reviews.Content: we were a bit uptight after reading the posts about this hotel.. we were expecting the worst,but when we got there we had no problems at all, the rooms were fine the breakfast was good,the staff were approachable and had time to talk to us about our questions,the only complaint was the cost of beer in the hotel lol,great location for saint peter.s square, tip for tourists heading to the vatican museum

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suzykDublin
Reviews.Content: After reading some reveiws on this hotel i was a little worried about my stay, i booked on recommendation of my uncle who had lived in Rome for 14 years, apparently some people found the staff rude, not so with us, we found them perfectly fine, reception was pleasant, booked restaurants for us and helped with luggage etc. Room was nice and clean, made up each day while we were out, maybe a little noisy early in morning, coaches taking people off on trips. Breakfast was perfectly ok, and the bar was nice if a little quiet and expensive but it is Rome and you must expect all of this!!

Reviews.Title: “Costa cruise second rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: cosmoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed a day before and a day after our cruise, the rooms we got were the lowest kind on the first floor where street and lobby noise made sleeping very hard. Also no coffee maker and bad coorrdination for the pier transfers. On the way back we were told there was no such transfer and had to hunt down the van after 30 anxious moments. Don't book with Costa, not at this hotel. And beware extra charges, taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for a Vatican area hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepthing1027
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group who had at least 30 hotels rooms booked in this hotel. At least half told me they had problems with their rooms. Our room was OK, but on the 2nd floor over the street so everytime we opened the window, we had A LOT of street noise. When tour buses from other groups showed up early in the morning and left their motors running, it was especially unpleasant. Since the front desk staff and general manager were generally unhelpful, we didn't bother to call downstairs. We figured they would tell us to close the window! We only asked them to call us a cab once, and that was such a hassle! The first time we asked, they told us they "don't do that!" Really? Why do you have that handy taxi machine on your counter? About the only pleasant part of the hotel was the breakfast staff. The coffee was hot. But, the breakfast selection left a lot to be desired. Canned fruit--the same meats and cheeses every day. The same under cooked eggs and bacon. A little variety would have been really nice--or at least the option to order something off a menu. If we ever make it back to Rome, we won't be staying at this hotel. It is close to Vatican City, but if you want to go anywhere else, it's a long walk or short taxi drive!

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in Quiet Area Very Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Shaz091
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our girlie weekend, and had a triple room. Check in was efficient and staff were welcoming and friendly. Our room was excellent 3 very comformtable single beds, the room was a very good size plenty of room for the three of us and our cases. Bathroom was very clean, good shower with plenty of hot water and good quality towels. Only downside no tea/coffee making facilites and no safe in the room. Breakfast was good, choice of yogurts, fruit, cereal, ham, cheese, scrambled eggs, bacon and variety of bread/crossaints. Water for the tea could have done with being hotter not very good for brewing. Breakfast can get busy, if coach trips are in the hotel and the staff were not very quick at clearing the dirty tables, or topping up the provisions. Location was quiet, but good right across the road from the Vatican, easy to walk to the other sights in Rome, although I think I would pick somewhere a little more central next time I visit, only to be closer to resturants/bars. Staff offered to arrange a taxi back to the airport for us at the hotel fixed rate, which was 47 euro's. This is much cheaper than taking a taxi at the airport/on street charge is 60/65 euro's. Overall this was a good hotel which was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, clean, friendly and helpful, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: getalonggang1970
Reviews.Content: we travelled as a group of 7 ladies all celebrating a significant birthday by spending 3 days in Rome. We selected this hotel due to the star rating and the good value for money compared to others of similar quality. We were not disapointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean. The staff were very helpful and efficient. The rooms were very clean with plenty of room, even in the room with 3 beds in. The location with the dome of St Peters in full view at the end of the street was very impressive. Just a short walk to St Peters square and access to all of the tourist 'hop on hop off' buses. we used these to get around the city at a bargain price of 17euros for 48 hours for unlimited stops. there are good reasonably priced places to eat nearby but it isnt far to walk (about 20 mins) to the main eating areas of piaza navona. we all felt very safe finding our way back to the hotel at night also and managed to get around on foot each night without any problems. The only negative point that we could make is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and the price of buying a pot of tea for 2 in the hotel was around 10 euros which we thought a bit expensive! The breakfast was good with a good selection of food. The pot of hot water provided for tea at the table wasnt always hot and not much good for making tea with but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK but certainly not GREAT”
Reviews.Author: JTB9110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property because my friend had booked an escorted tour of Italy and the 4 day stay in Roma was here. The Starhotel is near the Vatican; but not exactly centrally located for the main tourist sites in the city. The 64 bus runs often to the areas you want to go but is oftentimes packed with commuters. The breakfast was nice; but on some mornings before my friend's group arrived when I was solo and was put in a dark dank corner of the breakfast room. I ended up near a gentleman from San Juan PR every morning who was also solo so this seemed intentional. This hotel is big on bus tour groups. Stay closer to Piazza Venezia or somehwere down there; more convenient and more options.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican down the street, rooms very clean and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: simpletraveler
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay in this hotel again! St Peters is on the left side of hotel, look outside your room window & it's right there on your left, beautiful view, esp. at night. This hotel is surrounded by nice apartments, a small park in front, the main street a block away for all the shopping & restaurants/cafes. So, you just walk where you want to go, the Vatican museum, St Peters, and the bus line (on main street). Outside of hotel is plain, but inside, it's marbles, crystals, and fine furniture. Our room (triple bed) was big enough for all 3 of us. The beds very comfortable, we slept well. Bathroom was updated an very clean. Restaurant had very nice waitstaff & good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: BonnieL1
Reviews.Content: The Michelangelo is an old hotel but was clean with most of the amenities that you would need. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmer
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very nice and in a great location for sight-seeing. I would recommend a shuttle or taxi from the airport or main train terminal, however because that walk from the nearest metro stop is a bit long and confusing with luggage. The room was clean, decent sized, and comfortable. The breakfast was decent and I thought the hotel staff was helpful. You recieved 30 free minutes of internet, but have to purchase it after that. Overall a nice place to stay and I would definitely stay there again if I was going back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to Rome”
Reviews.Author: f-meechan
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my trip to Rome, and the Hotel Michelangelo was an ideal base for getting around the city. There was an excellent bus service and a train station near by. The hotel itself was excellent. Staff were all very helpful and pleasant and the standard of service and cleanliness was tip top! Breakfast offer was basic, but sufficient for setting you up for a day's exploring around Rome. We had a triple room, which was clean and well appointed. The bath was very narrow and quite high to get into, so perhaps not suitable for the elderly or infirm, but apart from that the towels, linen were pure white and of a good quality. Even the bath robe which was provided was lushhhh!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly arrogant staff,awful Breakfast, cold scrambled eggs.”
Reviews.Author: brian061073
Reviews.Content: Please please don't heed the reviews saying good things about this place.Location was great for the Vatican but this is what you are paying for.The Room is small for what you pay.Hotel staff are unfriendly and not very helpful.Breakfast is advertised as American,I honestly would not even expect a breakfast that bad in an American prison.Cold Scrambled eggs( no other choice of eggs) cold bacon full of fat,Dirty tables. If you are a non smoker forget it the air conditioning system pulls in smoke from the other rooms so you might as well book smoking

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Britt
Reviews.Content: The hotel presentation was very clean and elegant. The lobby was beautiful and staff was very polite and accomadating. Upon arrival our room was not quite ready since we were early for check-in time so the hotel staff held our locked luggage in the office while we walked around the city to get aquainted with Rome. The hotel is conveniently located within very close walking distance to Vatican City. We stayed for three nights and enjoyed our stay as well as the yummy breakfast spread! Although the breakfast room doubles as a restaurant for dinner we regretfully did not eat dinner there, however, the menu sounded as equally delicious as the breakfast was! Only one complaint: the bed was a little more firm than we liked and coupled with walking around the city all day, our lower backs ached for the duration of our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wannabetraveler45
Reviews.Content: We had a fine time at this hotel. Manuela (I hope I have her name right) was so attentive, friendly and patient with us, non-Italian speakers. Also, the bellman with the glasses (I didn not make note of his name) was extremly helpful. The other desk staff was helpful when asked, but didn't volunteer much and seemed very, "businessy", not as warm and welcoming as the other two. Our triple room was spacious. The bathroom was sumptuous and felt very American in size. The staff in the breakfast room and the room serivce waiter were all very helpful and attended to our every need. At one point, I ordered room service but I wasn't making myself clearly understood by the waiter. He then came up stairs to take my order face to face. It turned out that I had an outdated menu in my room. We got a shared chuckle out of that one, ala, "who's on first." Suggestions to the Hotel for improvement: 1) Paint the walls in the room one color. For some reason, our room had two different shades and textures of yellow paint, as though someone painted around furniture and then moved the furniture and painted the previously hidden space with new paint. 2) Volunteer or have more information available, relative to excursions. When I asked for tour or excursion information, the staff gave me one single pamphlet. I had the sense that the pamplet was for a tour operator that they exclusively work with and the tours were pretty limited, thus we had to "strike out" on our own. On another positive note, the beds were enormously comfortable, in fact, my son was looking for the tag to try to determine the manufacturer of the bed. We all slept very soundly. The hotel is right next to St. Peter's Basilica and within a few steps of many fine restaurants and Gelato stores. I woudl return again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to St. Peter Cathedral,good size room, excellent staff and value for Money”
Reviews.Author: manish2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel. It is located only 500 mteres from St. Peter basallica. It has good size rooms, Excellent front and back office staff and very helpful. Good connectivity to city center and other attraction by bus,taxi. The breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel in good location but don't look to staff for help”
Reviews.Author: BowlerX
Reviews.Content: nice king size bed with working AC, clean sheets and nice bath room.....breakfast included was just ok -- forget the coffee -- get the capachinno [spelling?]. The front desk staff is basically useless -- ask a very specific question and you might get a useful answer -- ask a general question and forget it. Walk to the Vatican for cabs as they charge extra for hotel pick up and do not take the hotel offerred private car to the airport -- take a cab for 40 euro flat fee or even better the BusShuttle for 8 per person

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican city Wall!!”
Reviews.Author: RTSMST
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Booking.com. This hotel is close to the Vatican city wall and could see the St.Peter's Catherdral Dome from our room!. Breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “Situation perfect, staff and attitude not so perfect”
Reviews.Author: BordersBlondie
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wed, 19th May, for our wedding anniversary on 20th May. Hotel looked like a good deal on the internet, almost half price per night - which I can't believe although the situation (outside you faced the Dome of St Peter's). Reception area was nice but the rooms, although very clean, looked like they could do with a good lick of paint. Don't know what's happened but in Rm 112 there were two shades of yellow going on - looked like they had painted round some furniture that they had in the room previous! Good job we had printed off about the Ciampino Airport taxi charges as the hotel tried to charge us 52Euros for a taxi from the hotel to the Airport. We told them we were not paying that as there was some sort of scam going on and the printout off the internet said that the Government had a set a standard price to stop this happening. The Receptionist said he knew nothing about that! We got him to order us another taxi (the normal ones that run about the streets) and we told him we were only paying 30 Euros and he said ok (although he did try to say he did not have change of a 50 Euro). We were going to give him a tip but after he said that we didn't bother. Hotel did not have any leaflets about Rome apart from the trips that they organised and even it did not have much to say! Couldn't find a leaflet either in the room or the foyer of the hotel. Nothing to tell you about when things opened or closed, prices, etc. Rome in general was very nice although quite expensive in the touristy parts - what was to be expected I suppose. Lots of beggers around the streets and unofficial stallholders trying to get you to buy stuff which you can do without. Rome itself was stunning and don't support I am likely to see anything like that ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SWFisherman
Reviews.Content: One accepts that there is likely to be a price hike in a hotel situated close to the Vatican, which Michelangelo is, but when combined with sloppy and smelly rooms, grumpy staff who think that they are doing YOU the favour (- not vice versa), and what we considered a generally poor quality service, it really does make you cross. Initial impression on entering is quite favourable, but rooms -even at superior level, are minute and poorly equipped (you can't even get an iron in the whole hotel, internet was expensive etc), the bathroom fascia was loose and with no functional fan there was a nasty musty smell in the room. Room cleaning staff seemed polite but things were never the same at front of house or in the bar which was always in a rush to close and seemed incapable of opening late if returning from a meal in Rome, which for a 4* hotel seemed amazing. It is all too easy to rant and I have never left feedback on sites like this but felt compelled to do so after returning home. 2 weeks ago I stayed in London for nearly half the rate and received a far superior service and know that I, and many of my colleagues, who felt likewise, will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like rude staff, dirty rooms, items taken out of your room...this is for you”
Reviews.Author: tailwater
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Michelangelo on May 1 2010. The hotel front dest was as rude as any hotel front desk that I have ever come across. (and as an airline pilot I have a lot of experience with hotels). The room was dirty, we had foot prints on the walls of the room, the internet was around 22 euro. I had my Iphone stolen right out of my room along with 160 usd. These items were not in plain view. I brought this to the attention of the front desk and they could care less. Very sad indeed. There are several other hotels in the area that I would recommend. This hotel is one I would never recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mizbehr
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this hotel for 6 days in april and running into May. The location cannot be beat. View of St. Peter's square and walking distance to restaurants as well as bus stops. Check in was easy and while the hotel staff is not overly friendly they were polite enough and helped us with questions we had regarding what bus to take, etc. The A/C wasn't working and when i called the front desk they simply said "there is no A/C." I guess they turn it off in certain seasons. The room was spacious enough and the bathroom was very clean. TV only had a few English speaking channels but we didn't really have time to watch much TV. The hotel does offer internet service for a fee of 9.00 for 24 hours of use. We didn't use the service. There is a restaurant nearby that has free WiFi. If you are booking tours this hotel is great as it is in central Rome and the tour companies will pick you off and drop you off at the hotel. The bus runs right across the street from the hotel that can take you to the bus terminal if needed. A bus ticket is 1.00 for an hour of usage but we rode the bus for free a few times as the busses were so crowded we didn't get a chance to validate our tickets before our stop. I saw alot of people not validating their tickets. The breakfast buffet was good but you had to be there early to get the good stuff. Eggs, Bacon, bread, pastries, cereal. The coffee was horrible! I don't know what they put in it but it had a very strange taste. They don't seem to "refill" alot of the food quickly and if you go past 9:30 there isn't much to choose from. Overall this hotel is great for it's location and cleanliness. I would stay here again. Overall this is a great hotel mostly due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Rome 2009 Trip with Family”
Reviews.Author: Jamiedip
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel. Great location within 2 blocks of the Vatican. Clean, Friendly, 4-star hotel. Rooms are not huge, but functional. Beds are very comfortable, room is kept clean and has all amentities. Daily Breakfast buffet included, with hot food (eggs, bacon). I will continue to stay in this hotel every visit I make to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, close to the Vatican with good staff”
Reviews.Author: AJLondonLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip via Expedia and were disappointed to be taken to a 3 single bedded room. We are a family of 3 with then 3 year old child. The hotel staff couldn't be more helpful. They moved us to a different room with a double bed and space for our daughter. I would describe the hotel as functional rather than luxurious but it has everything you need. Breakfast was very nice and all in all we thought we got great value for money in a good location. The staff were child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort comes first”
Reviews.Author: smoiro
Reviews.Content: Just like the title says, Comfort comes first, and they take it seriously. When you arrive, the reception welcomes you in a very professional and friendly way, speaking in english easily.
