There is a nice gentleman to help you with your luggage until your room and make sure everything is as you like. Arriving to the room you find a nicely decorated room with a convenient table and two comfortable chairs very useful to work on your laptop or upload some holiday photos through the wired or wireless facilities provided (charges apply). The bathroom is spacious and modern providing all you need. THIS IS JUST THE START. The best comes when you go to sleep. The bed is extremely comfortable and the hotel is fan of pillowmania. They provide you up to 6 different types of pillows, just to make sure that you feel in heaven. The breakfast is buffet style and you have a good variety to choose from and always someone nearby to help you just in case. The restaurant could be improved but...being in Rome and so close to many restaurants would you want to stay in the hotel for dinner/lunch ? The hotel is very well located and highly recommended if you plan to visit Vatican City. It is also close to tube stations which connect you to the train lines and the airport. Summary This was the best experience until now and I plan to return, this time for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, rude front desk...”
Reviews.Author: Ronp09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the michael angelo hotel on our honey moon trip the room was small, AC was not functioning well, breakfast is ok but dont expect more than egg, bacon, cheese and stop counting... the good thing is that you have the vatican city right in front of the hotel a near bus stop that let's you very close to every important attraction of the city cstelo san angelo is also near... nice restaurant are close to the hotel... overall I recomend to stay at the hotel.... is nice and a good value...

Reviews.Title: “trip was prior to 2007; however, friends referred were equally happy”
Reviews.Author: LuAnnH3
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with friendly staff. Just steps from the Vatican. This was a family managed hotel with personalized service. Restaurant was pricey for the fare; however, the service was excellent and there were many little Mom and Pop cafes in the area. \

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rob287
Reviews.Content: Went last val day with my GF, very nice hotel and great location, only fault i found was bar was expensive. Front desk was helpful of showing us where to go. Becareful when you get a taxi there though we got ripped off when we arrived. I would stop here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: johnandmary0608
Reviews.Content: The accomodations at this hotel were fine, the continental breakfast was more than adequate. The location is terrific, with several nearby good restaurants, a wonderful bakery and a nice fresh fruit and vegetable store. Our problem was with front desk personnel who were absolutely rude. I had two occasions to interact with them and both times were insulted. Our small mini-bar refrigerator was actually hot. The front desk sent someone to check it and he insisted it was fine. We endured it for the five nights we were there by begging for a cup of ice from the bar. Later I needed the front desk to look up the room number of a friend and the clerk scowled and barked at me. Even just by walking past the front desk the clerks were always scowling. We are frequent travelers and we're used to smiling clerks who greet you pleasantly. These men were entirely different. Maybe it's a Roman thing!

Reviews.Title: “Two single beds pushed together”
Reviews.Author: EUROTRIP4444
Reviews.Content: Firstly do not be decieved by the photos the hotel company have published over the internet, after shopping around for an ideal hotel for our first holiday together me and my girlfriend decieded on this hotel for its location and to behonest because of the look of the rooms. We choose to go for a superior room rather than a standed double, We paid an extra 200 euros for a superior room, to find that the bed was two single beds pushed together which became seperated during the night, the carpet was not clean, the furniture was old and damaged and the room really needed a coat of paint, the bathroom was unclean and although we left the do not disturb sign on the door the maid still entered the room in the morning. the breakfast buffet in the morning was brought to our room cold and the order was not correct. Iwould only recomend this hotel for its location near to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, near vatican city”
Reviews.Author: vanaba
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, rooms clean, shower great water pressure, beds comfortable, could use alittle paint on the walls, but room was spotless. Breakfast buffet was very good. Bartender Luigi, nice young italian man. Front desk staff nice but gruff at times. Very close to Vatican I bought the roma pass at the Termini station, gives you entrance into 2 museums plus discount to others, and bus and metro ticket for 3 days from activation. Nobody uses tickets on the bus, mom and I were the only ones validating our tickets. So my question is do you really need a bus ticket????? Did see a few tourists validating, tho. Don't think that I would do the roma pass again, should have done a hop-on hop-off bus instead, takes you to the high point areas, trevi, spanish steps, etc. We wanted to catch the high points, not all the museums of art, which I'm sure a beautiful, but not our thing. The Vatican is a must, but buy your ticket before you come to rome or a few days before you plan to visit if you are in the city for a few days. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ronanddale
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to St. Peter's. For cruise passengers that are staying in Rome before their cruise, the hotel is close to the St. Peter's train stop where you can get a train for a very low cost. It goes to Civitavecchia in about an hour with a few stops on the way. We walked the few blocks because we traveled pretty lightly with rolling luggage. No problem! I thought the price was fair, considering the location. Breakfast was more than I have experienced at other hotels in Italy (and is included).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: MarcieB3
Reviews.Content: Walk out the front door, look left, and you see the dome of St.Peters. 2 blocks from the Square. Get a ticket on the double decker tour bus and Rome is yours! There is a small market next door, and great pizza around the corner. Great room, fabulous breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sunpickle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just last weekend. Had a great time, staff were helpful, hotel clean and in a great location (espcially if you want to be near St Peters square!!) Also quiet, which you wouldn't get if in centre of Rome. Prices not too expensive either considering where it is (£5 for wine or prosecco) always with nibbles too! :) Rooms well appointed, especially for us ladies with make up to do! Hairdryers a bit wierd, so glad I had my own. Some rooms have a balcony (our friends did) but you can still get a great view of the Vatican even if you don't have a balcony. Local area good (nice foodmarket just a few doors along, where we got beer 1.50euro and bottle of really nice wine for about 3euro...handy as rooms have a fridge! As always Italians brilliant and so friendly, recommended us restaurants, within your budget. Cab service excellent too, no worries getting to centre in the evening (heels a no go on cobbled streets!) Would stay here again. Oh one little :( no tomatoes at breakfast (strange for a tom growning country!) would have liked that with bacon and scrambled egg!! Otherwise breakfasts fab, plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO VATICAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sv1dkr
Reviews.Content: It a very good hotel for the money that we have paid occupied 2 double rooms (family of 4) close to the Vatican about 5 mins walk and in a quite neighbourhood (august visit).Parking was a pleasure as with only 20 euro per day they could pick your car park it and make it available again when you need it.Also close to small restaurants you can eat cheep. Pleasant beds and good breakfast too personel helpfull and polite.Only luck of free internet and the use of expensive Swiss com slow connection

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: anthony945
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that for the price, you simply cannot beat this place. We stayed here for 5 nights in August at a great rate. This hotel is a good value. Other than that, a couple of areas for improvement: (i) room was extremely dusty on a daily basis; personal items were covered in dust as were table tops and dresser areas; (ii) location is close to Vatican but far from everything else; cabs are necessary in the August heat / cabs can get expensive during off-peak times since in Italy you start paying for the cab as soon as it is dispatched to pick you up (sometimes the meter would say 10 euros as we got in it!); (iii) free breakfast gets boring after a day; the assortment does not change - the waitstaff looks like they could have been replacements for the stooges - and the old man who shows you to the table has a tendency to stick his hand in the food! My girlfriend saw him putting his hand in the granola and pick out raisins twice. I saw him use his hand to re-arrange the bread basket. I guess you get what you pay for when it comes to the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: znapper
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and elegant and it looked pretty new to us. Our room was a standard room for two persons and our room was both very clean and inviting, the bathroom had a shower/bathtub, toilet, sink and a bidet, had nice bright tiles. The only negative think about our room, was that there was no safe there, but you can borrow a safe locker in the reception area if you want.. There was enough towels, both for washing and drying and everything was changed every day. Much has been said about the staff in the earlier reviews, but I must say that I experienced the staff as either; - Happy and polite (smiling etc) - Neutral and polite (not smiling, but still nothing like cross/grumpy). We never experienced negative staff during our 3 nights in Rome and we got clear and quick assistance when we did have an question. I suppose it sometimes comes down to how you approach people, usually I approach with a smile and a positive attitude. Breakfast was what I'd like to refer to as a "Traditional hotel/English breakfast", bacon, eggs and loads of various bread and stuff to put on, really nice, though we only ate there once. The location of the hotel is so that you will have to take the bus if you'd like to see stuff like the Colosseum, the Spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain etc. The busses stops just about 100 meters from the hotel and the trip from the hotel to Palazzo Venezia took 10 minutes, from there you can stroll towards the Colosseum, admiring the various ruins along the avenue. We booked the hotel to be away from the worst of the huzzle and buzzle and it worked out fine. All in all, we were happy with the hotel, our non-smoking room was indeed non-smoking (no old smell of cigarettes in our room) and the air condition was able to chill the room so much that we had to turn it back. Just a tip, if you check with the tourist information at Fiumicino airport's train station area, you can get a airport shuttle directly to the hotel, the number to call when you need a shuttle back, is toll free, so you can call them on day in advance from your hotel room and book a shuttle with no problems. (the trip to the hotel from the airport with the shuttle, took about 25 minutes and our shuttle was on time +-3 minutes to our booking time). Also, while still in the airport, pop in to the tourist information desk and buy a Roma pass, it cost €25 and gives you a 3 day pass on all public communication, maps and a ticket that give you free entrance to two of the sites in Rome (+50% off additional sites you want to visit).

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated, High Priced & NOT Handicap-Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: EdenSprings
Reviews.Content: Traveled with friends (one in a wheelchair) to Rome. Chose this hotel due to proximity to Vatican City and because they advertised 'handicap' access rooms. Don't know who gave them 4 stars, but the only thing 4 star is their price! Continential bkfst was the same every day--average and not imaginative. Even the desk clerk told us not to eat dinner there due to the astronomical prices. There are many good restaurants within walking distance that offer great meals for E10 or so a plate. While it IS close to the Vatican, what nobody tells you is that the entrance for the tours in on the exact OPPOSITE side of Vatican City. You can't get there from here without a l-o-n-g walk or a tax ride of appx E10. It is in a quiet spot, but many rooms look out on an apartment block. Now, as for the handicapped access. This is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at for that. While the bathrooms do have wheel-in showers, (we stayed in 2 different H/C rooms) one offered dual rails at the toilet and had sufficient room to wheel in and out, the other was a joke. You needed to wheel down a short, narrow hallway with a sharp turn at the end, and then there was NO ROOM for the chair anywhere. We had to shove furniture out of the way to get the chair close enough to the bed to transfer! You needed to shut the bathroom door to wheel past the bathroom to get into the hallway (there wasn't enough room for the door to open flat against the wall) in order to get in/out of the room. The extreme turn you needed to make into the bathroom required the chair to be manually LIFTED, and there wasn't enough room in the bath for the chair, so transfers to the toilet required several steps. There was no room in the bath to turn the chair, so exiting required backing out. I think the manager should be strapped into a wheel chair, made to drink a half-gallon of water and locked into room #221 to appreciate just what a cruel joke their handicapped-access experience is.

Reviews.Title: “"Accidental Tourist" from the Bronx loved it”
Reviews.Author: Minkstapedis
Reviews.Content: As a Bronx native from an Italian-American neighborhood, I loved this hotel. I had a small terrace from which I could see St. Peter's dome. I could go out in my PJs and survey the passing scene and little garden across the street . The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom updated and hot water/water pressure were excellent. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which offered an assortment that could satisfy anyone, and the byplay among the waiters in the dining room was entertaining. The surrounding neighborhood reminded me of the Bronx, with the men's club around the corner and a nearby fruit & vegetable stand. I found the hotel a very comfortable place to rest and relax without any offputting pretensions. My tour was Church oriented, so the proximity to the Vatican was desirable. I had never traveled abroad before and had some trepidation, but this hotel made me feel safe, welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy but lovely”
Reviews.Author: dizzypigFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very simple. It is extremely clean. When we first checked in, our room was small and we asked for a different room and were immediately switched...and they were very pleasant. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. There were a couple of crabby front desk people but I avoided them for the nice ones. The rooms were not huge. The beds are VERY comfy. This hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Vatican. You can actually see the dome from the hotel. The location is great! The buffet breakfast in the morn is outrageous. I dont know how this hotel makes money. Room rates are cheap and the breakfast extensive. They also have a ton of help in the restaurant. I will say that the room was never quite as cold as I would have liked it, but I like it cold. Also, I am not sure if this is an American thing but I use a wash cloth. They don't have them so bring your scrunchy or whatever you bathe with. The lobby is a good size and very comfy to sit and people watch. The service at this hotel was wonderful and I would love to return someday. NO ONE was rude....they went out of their way to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: faf1960
Reviews.Content: Reading some of these reviews surprises me. The room we (3 people) had was lovely. Seemed updated...hardwood floors, very large room for Rome, clean, full breakfast, etc. They arranged our car svc back to the airport (good price relative to other quotes). I would definitely recommend staying here.....perhaps check and see if there are recently renovated rooms vs. not and be sure to request accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Next to Vatican/Train Station/Bus pick-up, Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: dredd4567
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fairly nice with great location next to the Vatican City, bus pick-ups which take you straight into the heart of Rome. Recommend bus #64 (make a left out of hotel, right on the major street, and pick-up right before the tunnel) which takes you right into Plaza Venezia in the heart of Rome – this can be walked in under 30min. The hotel staff spoke good English and was quite helpful. The room itself was decent size for Rome, the air conditioning works well, and CNN International in English on TV. Very good breakfast buffet served in the mornings. Would definitely recommend this hotel, even though it is not the cheapest it is still less expensive than “downtown” Rome, and due to proximity of buses to get to touristy locations.

Reviews.Title: “Aging dowager of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSailors
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its location, good next to Vatican. First room was dirty and tiny. Got moved to a lower floor where rooms had been redone. Lots of traffic in this hotel. Some staff nice, some not so. Lost our cameras here, so our memories are somewhat soured by the staff's lack of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jacksonbenji
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty, dingy, and disgusting. We requested a King bed because this was our anniversary trip, and we got 2 twin beds, that were not set up next to each other. The walls had dirt and handprints on them, and the bathroom was rusted and dirty. To make matters worse, the staff was not helpful-we asked them to call our airline to confirm our flight to NY, and they told us to do it ourselves from the room, and then tried to charge us for the phone call. Last time I checked that is the job of the concierge. And when we asked them to send 2 wine glasses upstairs to use, they said we would have to pay a room service fee. I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rome!”
Reviews.Author: pvbeach
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from a transatlantic cruise which ended in Rome. We stayed in Rome an addtional three days and it was excellent! Our hotel was the Star Michelangelo in the Vatican, three stars, large rooms, friendly staff and decent breakfast. It was a long walk to attractions other than the Vatican, but doable.The first day we took an on-off bus for an overview of the city. The one we took was Rome Open Tour, and I would definitely not recommend it; the narration was sparse and most of the headphones were not working. There are at least three other open tour buses and I recommend you try one of these! The traffic in Rome is crazy and you must be cautious when crossing the street. Rome is swarming with people, and I understand it's like that any time of year! Some of our favorites: Piazza Navona (at night when musicians perform), St. Peter's (awesome), Trevi Fountain and Pantheon (almost unbelievable!) If you can afford it, I would recommend taking a private tour. In five hours you will learn more history and see more sights than on your own; we used Rome Limos Tours run by the Miglio family and it was fantastic. Rome is expensive for Americans, especially the restaurants. It is awe inspiring to see these ancient sights and the city is vibrant and exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and service variable but close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Chiquitawonder
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the middle of May. We booked 3 rooms. Two of the rooms had old carpet flooring and smoke smells lingering in the room (despite requesting non-smoking rooms). The other room had hardwood floors (nice), but an air conditioning system which worked at times and didn't at other times. The bathtub/shower was strange with the shower head installed on the horizontal and shower curtains that were not long enough for the entire tub. Otherwise, the washroom was clean. Walls were dirty and grimy. Buffet was quite good, especially considering that it was included in the price of the room. The service of staff at the front desk was efficient, but was not overly friendly. In fact, they seemed to discourage questions. Transfer to the airport was expensive, and would not recommend it. (You can take public transportation for much cheaper if you don't have a gazillion bags like how we did). Staff was downright rude when we told him we would think about the airport transfer as the price was high. However, service improved later in the day when we asked for a good place to eat - staff was willing to point us to a good restaurant in the area. Service was variable. If you want to see the Vatican, this is a good place to stay as it is close. It is also quite close to the metro. Found the location to be quite good considering the price. Not sure if we would recommend this hotel given the variability in the room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1009
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied with this hotel in all respects. It's not 5 star, but in doesn't claims to be. The room was fairly large for European/Rome standards. The bathroom had a full size tub with shower. We had a great view of the Vatican and a balcony. The only thing I thought the room was lacking was a safe. I thought the location was great. It's obviously a short walk to the Vatican, but all of the other sites are a fairly easy walk as well. The coliseum is probably the furthest site, but it's probably no more than a 30 minute walk. The only time we took a taxi was to and from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “standard rooms, not that great.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in beginning of April. The hotel is right around the corner from the Vatican and St Peters. It looks like its right across the street from the photos but you must walk around to get to both places. The metro is not close but about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. We were given a standard room upon arrival. The room was a bit drabby. The carpet looked dirty and the walls and curtains were dirty. Definitely not like the photos you see on the website. The bathroom was extra clean. We later found out why it was extra clean. The shower didnt have a lip around it so when you showered all the water ran out and flooded the bathroom. We had to build a "levy" from towels to keep the water from running all over the place. This was very annoying. The walls were very thin as well. We could hear the neighbors as if they were in the same room with us. We werent in the room much so it wasnt that much of a big deal. Breakfast was good. Ham and eggs, fruits, breads, yogurt, cereal, juices. We didnt think highly of the hotel until we returned a couple of days later after staying at other starhotels in Venice and Florence. On our return we were upgraded (without asking) to an executive room. The experience was totally different. The executive room was very nice. Separate living room. Bathroom had a nice tub. Didnt have to worry about the water running all over the place. The key to getting an executive room is by requesting a king bed. Otherwise you'll get stuck with a standard room with 2 beds. So the standard rooms are 1-2 stars and the executive rooms are 4 stars at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Reester56
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, decent sized. Met our expectations based on all the reviews posted here. It's not very convenient to other sites, but very convenient to Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: lukerja
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, room clean. Breakfast was quite large. Included in the price. Restaurant waiters really friendly. the main big advantage is proximity to the Vatican and in general the disposition. Right across the river you could find a lot of very nice restaurants (Antica Romana was great!) What we didn't like was that some services like fax or internet were for payment, whereas in other hotels we'd been before they were gratis. Cleaning ladies a little too annoying, if you stay for vacations you do not expext to be woken up by a tel call and asked if you want your room to be cleaned or not....the staff was not helpfull... What i would recomend to the hotel is to be more customer-orientated....

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anni373
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We spent one night here on Christmas Eve. The closeness to the Vatican was great, and the hotel is really easy to find. The room was clean with a large bed and a clean bathroom. The shower had nice pressure and the only minor complaint was that it drained slowly. The front desk staff was very nice and spoke english well. The breakfast was delciious...a large buffet with pastries, yogurt, different drinks, meats, cheeses, and cereal. I would stay here again in a second !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: While the hotel wasnt as great as it appears on the website, it was quite adequate. I would rate it as 3 star instead of 4 or maybe a 3.5 The breakfast was good and the room was clean and nice. The best part was the awesome location. Its literally a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. I didnt have a Vatican view room so cant comment about the view. I booked this at the last moment through Expedia and got a very good price. The only downside was that the room was a bit small. Also, I feel the management could refurbish the room with some more contemporary fittings to make it a 4 star. The decor appeared slightly dated (Though not at all dirty or tired). While here, make sure to visit the Vittorio (Or Vittoria) pizzeria which serves the most amazing pasta and has been around since 1919. Its one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a decent location...”
Reviews.Author: jacko_1979
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a pretty good location. This is classed as a 4* hotel and i probably wouldn't disagree with that. We had a classic double room which was pretty small but had a large king size bed in it. Unfortunatly our room's view wasn't great but that did little to effect the feeling of the room. The room was very very clean which is something we hold high up in our 'must haves' for a hotel room. My only real negative would be that the water wasn't very hot for a bath or a shower, in fact too cold for a bath altogether. The rest of the hotel was very nice. The foyer was beautiful and the bar area was lovely with great service, a bit on the dear side but thats to be expected. The reception staff were very helpful and spoke good english. The breakfast was really nice and very plentiful with good drinks service. We never used the resteraunt for an evening meal so can't really comment on that. The location of the hotel is pretty good, within 2 mins walking distance of the Vatican City and about 10 mins on a bus from the colliseum, or 5 mins in a taxi, about 8 euros. Altogether a very pleasent hotel and i would use again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very clean”
Reviews.Author: johnd7bostonMA
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel while visiting my son who was studying abroad for the semester. We chose this hotel because my son's apartment was right around the connor. I was very pleased with the hotel. The rooms were very clean and the staf was friendly. They had a large breakfast included in the room. the breakfast was in a small resturant in the basement. The food was good and plentiful! Frsh fruit and juices, lots of pasteries, eggs, etc. It is not a very pretty location but it is close to the vatican. The nost important part for me is clean room and bathroom. Plenty of hot water and towels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: nikkilovespink
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recomended to my by a former colleague who stayed there. She thaught it was lovely and we were looking forward to our trip, however, after reading some awful reviews on tripadvisor I became a little wary. Tha hotel was well maintained, extremely clean and we had no problems with staff (whom other travellers believed to be rude- one staff member has been named and shamed in another review and was lovely to us- gave us a free upgrade on our room!). Yes, the food was expensive, but what do you expect from a hotel! and in Rome, it's not like you have to wander far for a decent restaurant. Very close to all attractions if you're doing the usual 'tourist' thing. Tha only 'problem' for us was the breakfast. there was nothing wrong with it, just not our thing (we're frightfully British and like a bit of a fry up). Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in August 2008 on a Globus Tour. The location was great, walking distance to the Vatican and St. Peters Square. Short bus ride to the historic area as well. Rooms were beautiful and so were the bathrooms! Shower was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude service”
Reviews.Author: CalifPartyofFive
Reviews.Content: We just spent two weeks between London, Paris and Rome. By far the rudest service we recieved was from the staff at The Hotel Michelangelo in Rome. The front desk seemed put out to provide any services what so ever. As an example when asked to call us a cab the staff threw both hands in the air and gave me the universal "ummph" when I told him we were a party of five. When asked to use the internet to which we would pay the typical overpriced hotel access fee (standard at all hotels it seems) we were told "It would be very dificult for us and perhaps waiting until morning and using the internet cafe across the street would be easier for us". The final straw came when we went to check out and we almost missed our shuttle trying to get the bill resolved. The front desk had to remove a bogus minibar charge from our account and then insisted we settle our bill in "cash" because the credit card machine was down. The other european hotels we stayed at, cabs we took, restaurants we ate at were all terrific and wonderful experiences. The Hotel Michelangelo itself was very clean and it's proximity to the Vatican was great. But if you don't want one star service at a four star price, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda707
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Michelangelo. Our room, 706, was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nunissimo
Reviews.Content: Very clean, better than expected breakfast, quiet neighbourhood. Well located, near the vaticano , where there are lots of fountains of fresh water- precious in July when the temperature rises to 40ºC!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Starhotels Michaelangelo for four nights in the first week of July as part of a vacation package from Costco Travel. The only positive attribute the hotel has is its close proximity to the Vatican. Every member of the staff we encountered had a negative, snobby and unfriendly attitude. The breakfast buffet was poor. One morning, the bacon was not cooked thoroughly. Unfortunately, there are no restaurants that serve breakfast in the area, so we had no other options. The cleanliness in the hotel room was lacking. There were brown stains in the toilet when we checked into the room. The bathroom sink and towel racks are much too close to the toilet. There was very little shelf space in the bathroom. Holes in the closet door were patched up, but not painted over. There were a number of large scratches and ink marks on the walls. Our bellman merely dropped off our bags in our rooms. Unlike other hotels, he did not ask us if we had any other requests or point out any of the features of the room and hotel. Cooling air from the air conditioner was very weak, even when turned up to the max. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: twoboos
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and unlike a lot of other reviewers of this hotel, I am staying here on business and not for sightseeing. I wont bother coming back here again. I checked in and they gave me a room with a two single beds and a desk that the TV took most of the space up. I need desk space for my work I asked to change rooms and they did to a smaller one, but it had a decent sized bed. The airconditioning is weak and just doesnt seem to cool the room down. As I write its nearly 95 degrees outside.Internet connection is fast in the rooms, but drops off occasionally. I had dinner in the restaurant last night. Its awful. The waiter was miserable and the waitress looks like she is more concerened how she looks than how the guests feel. I had a plate of veal escalopes which were 2 tiny thin pieces of veal and 5 slices of potato and it cost 24 Euros, add that to half a bottle of wine and a bottle of water it came to 48 Euros, absolutely extortionate!! There are a couple of decent (cheaper) restaurants along the road if you turn right out of the hotel and take a left at the petrol station The room was clean but the bathroom is small and has no bath, just a corner shower unit. No shelf to put my toiletaries. Not particularly convenient The hotel bar is small and hardly anyone uses it. There are no gym facilities in thsi hotel which I do like to use where available. I would definatley say that as a business hotel its no good, but if you are on a tour of Rome/Italy and its a hotel that you are using as a base for a couple of days, then it will do. If you are looking for somewhere to stay for a weeks holiday/honeymoon/business trip, you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you are a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Smart_Traveler_333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok in the looks department, certainly not in a 4* range but Rome hotels are notorious for claiming 4*s so this issue will be elsewhere too. The room we stayed in was fine for a 3* hotel but the AC didnt work. Upon complaining the repairman came , felt the paltry trickle of cold air and said it was fine. After complaining they moved us to another room which the air was better. After coming back to the hotel in the evening the AC was throwing out warm air. On calling the front desk, the hotel claimed that the AC was not on beyond 7 PM (when the guests need it the most!) To boot, no fan was available. Very uncomfortable to sleep in when its 80F outside! The area around the hotel is fairly dead with very few restaurants. The breakfast in the hotel was terrible and not even worth the free price. The staff service was decent but no AC and terrible breakfast with a bad location make me tell others look at other properties in the main city.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Shawn04
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. It is a hub for local tours and cruises and is literally steps from St. Peter's Cathedral and Vatican city. On the map it seems as if it is far away from downtown, but I have come to realize that things that appear to be miles away are only blocks from each other, and walking is usually quicker than taking a taxi because of the traffic congestion. And it allows you tosee more of the city anyway! There is a regional train stop ~1 block behind the hotel that you can take to many areas in the city as well as the central train station to connect to the airport express. The staff is friendly and multi-lingual so there is little difficulty in finding someone to translate your thoughts or needs into Italian. The rooms are clean and spacious(for Europe), the beds are comfortable and it is situated in a quiet location. I was able to sleep with the balcony door open on nights it was cool enough and did not have any problems with hearing trash trucks at 4am, or cars racing around etc...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelermarc
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Starhotels Michelangelo in late April, 2008. Check in was handled well and we were able to access the room at 9:00 in the morning after an overnight flight. The location, within 2 blocks of St. Peter's Basilica, was great for our Vatican based trip and general sight-seeing. Breakfast buffet was included with the room. A nice selection of foods was offered. The hotel caters to a business crowd and the staff was not overly friendly but were efficient. The room was clean and adequate. We were glad that we had read reviews of hotels and learned about leaving the keys whenever you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: parksre
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in residential area, but right next to Vatican/Sistine Chapel. You can easily get the bus (they run every 10 minutes) to the Colosseum, Pantheon, Via Della Corsini, all of the other attractions that Rome has. The food was good, service impeccable, Rooms were nice. If one is used to the smaller sized rooms in NYC, then the rooms a the hotel are similar in size. The staff was very kind and helpful with directions and such. Most spoke English and even if they don't, hand gestures convey your point just fine. Hotel is right near an Internet Cafe and many restaurants. We would stay there again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy guests!”
Reviews.Author: ChichesterTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Simple check in and bags carried straight up to room for us. Room was very clean, bright and smelled fresh with all amenities as advertised and was cleaned/made up/topped up everyday for us whist we were out. Could see St. Peters from window. Great bathroom. Mini bar expensive, no shock there though and with all the fantastic food and drink on offer in the city, do you really need a can of pepsi!?! location great, could walk everywhere but also that bit quieter at night. huge buffet breakfast with very friendly staff and endless coffee! We didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tbeusch
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Michelangelo. The staff was courteous and helpful with most speaking English. The room was clean and in good condition. The bed, pillows and covers were very comfortable. We were on the top (7th) floor which has no balconey, but being only a 10 minutes walk from St. Peter's Square who needs a hotel view? We ate dinner at the hotel several times and enjoyed good food and service. The breakfast was above normal for Europe. There are several restaurants close to the hotel; all decent but they refused to accept platic. However, we found the restaurants on the far side of the Vatican to be better. We recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: cocofly
Reviews.Content: Star Michelangelo Rome had the worst front desk customer service I've ever encountered. The service however in the dining room was much better. But bad service really ruined my trip. I had booked for family of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids. When we got there, Philipp (the rudest one), argued that i had only booked for two people. So i had to go pay to use their internet service to print out my confirmation saying 2 adults and 2 kids. So when I showed it to them.. they spoke in Italian to each other and said nothing to me. Then a lady says that it's going to be 30 Euro more each night! If i had known that I would of chosen a better hotel. They made us wait about 15 minutes til our room was ready but the thing that bothered me the most was they didn't even say sorry. Location was is good for the Vatican. But far away from everything else. When we were checking out, we had parked our car into their garage, which was 20 Euro a day. This might have been our fault since we didn't have Euro on us. But I paid with a credit card for the hotel and when it was time for our car charge , they said that they couldn't take it because it was from a different company. So they sent my husband to look for one. Well after 1 hour of walking. My husband told them that he couldnt find an ATM to where they sent him to. We had otld them before we werent aware that it was a different company and why weren't we informed? So treated us rudely in the beginning and in the end... they told my husband that they would just charge our credit card for garage..when they said they couldn't in the the beginning. So needless to say, we hated that hotel and their staff. NOTE: It would be a descent hotel but the staff made it really unpleasent. Plus they give you a key to your room not a card. So if you dont wanna carry a key with a big bell as a keychain, you have to leave it at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shine_on_you
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel in Rome several years ago and I really liked it. The room was fairly spacious, especially by European standards. Bathroom was above average--spacious and great. We had an awesome view of St. Pauls cathedral right from our 3rd floor window. Such a great view, especially at night! When booking, I would definitely request room with St.Paul view--you'll get some street noise, but for me the view was much worth it. Staff was polite and friendly. Breakfast was good and plentifull. It is true, hotel is a good 30-45min. (depending how fast you walk) walk to Piazza Navona, but I think Rome is so big, and there is so much to see, you really have to choose accomodations that are closest to the place/area you want to see the most. For us it was Vatican, so this hotel was perfect. Also, we mostly walked to all major attractions, and those were very, very pleasant walks and really helped us discover new places and feel the spirit of the city. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...”
Reviews.Author: dougalch
Reviews.Content: ..but maybe I'm just fusy. The hotel is located close to the Vatican and the train station is close enough and serves fumicino airport directly for 11euro each way. The main centre of the city is a little distance out but if you like walking not too far. Check-in staff were friendly and the bellman brings your luggage up and shows you to your room. Our room was directly in front of the lifts on the second floor beside the shoe polishing machine. The noise of the tour buses and then the daily morning traffic did annoy us especially at 6am! The room I booked and the room I got were not the same, we got a room with two single beds (on wheels) instead of the double bed that was booked. There is no safe - located at reception instead. The decor needed to be attended to and the vent on the wall was loose. The bathroom although clean had a very bad smell. When asking about the smell and the lack of a double bed at reception an airfreshener was installed!! The bar is small and expensive and the staff quite formal, same for the dining room and english is not good, granted nor is my Italian! 5Euro for bottle beer, 10 for a shot of vodka/ spirit / cocktails. Bar snacks are on offer f.o.c.. Breakfast is buffet but you will feel intimidated by the staff hovering around you. A dated hotel living not living up to previous reviews. Would suit tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “A Stone's Throw From the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: citizenkain
Reviews.Content: The Starhotels Michelangelo is an excellently located hotel if you're looking to spend time in Vatican City. It is about a 5 minute walk to St. Peter's Square, and appx 10 to 15 minutes to the entrance to the Vatican Museum. The hotel itself was pretty nice. The staff was very friendly (I loved waking up and seeing the cleaning staff stop and say "Buongiorno!" to me every morning) and were able to converse in English. I had a ground floor room which meant traffic was somewhat noisy, and since the floors are wood I could hear the lady above me walk around in her high heels at night. There was a breakfast provided, but I'm not much of a breakfast person; from what I could see and smell though it looked great. There is a small grocer next door to the hotel where you can purchase snacks and drinks. It is also about a block away from some restaurants including a good gelato stand. I'd say the only negative of this hotel was that if you wanted to see the major Roman sites (Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, etc.) it's a pretty healthy walk to the nearest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyParker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for six nights. Although the hotel would not allow us to eat their breakfast buffet the morning we arrived, it allowed us to explore the local eatries around the hotel. As soon as you walk out the front door, you can see St. Peter's dome. We stayed on the first floor. There was not alot of traffic in the front of the hotel, so it was not too bad. The bed was a little hard. The floors were hardwood, just beautiful. The room size was plenty. The bathroom was excellent. However, a safe was not located in the room; it was at the front desk. The breakfast buffet is good, nice variety. The staff is helpful and professional. They do have an interest that you have to pay for, it is not a bad rate. There are many great little cafes around the hotel. We tried a different one each night. While we were in Rome, the taxi drivers decided to go on strike for one day. The hotel helped us to make other transportation arrangements for our sight seeing activities: the bus, which was actually quite nice. The taxis are not expensive. There is an ATM nearby. Also, a great wine shop is across the street. The guy running it is very knowledgable and made some great suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Starhotels Michelangelo/Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelsomemore2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Criuse after first staying in Rome at the Michelangelo.I was concerned by some of the reviews I read although more recent ones expressed satisfaction. I would stay there again for the location next to the Vatican was teriifiic,the hotel employees were helpful,the breakfast was plentiful .Local eateries were good and not expensive.The local restaurant employees were very gracoius even though there was a language problem at times The room was clean,and large enough for 2 of us.The bathroom was also clean and in good repair.It was warm and we could regulate the room temp. We felt very secure although every where including on the tours you are cautioned agaist pickpockets. We felt safe there and would recommend it for a good location with access to transportation either by bus tours, taxis or local transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Dining Room”
Reviews.Author: middleboro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, The hotel was fine just the Mtre D in the dining room was the roodest person I met in Italy. Theres a really good Chinese Rest. within walking distance to the Hotel that was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTourist2007
Reviews.Content: Meals were good, staff helpful, accommodation more than adequate and the hotel is close to the Vatican and provides a good base for access to other attractions. We wnt with a Globus tour group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: can1003
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It was a 5 min walk to the Vatican and only a 10 min drive to the Colosseum. Free breakfast every morning that was not bad. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a balcony facing the front of the hotel. We could see Saint Peters Church from our balcony. The rooms were clean and not a bad size. The room key was not a card but an actual key that was bulky to carry around. the best thing to do is leave it at the front desk when you go out and pick it back up when you come back. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, But Not A 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeerHaven
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Starhotels Michelangelo for a week during our 30th wedding anniversary. We selected this hotel through a vacation package offered by Travelocity. The hotel is quite convenient for access to The Vatican (where we spent a lot of time), and other locations as well, especially if you're willing to walk or take public transportation (which we did). We were initially taken aback when we first arrived at the hotel's location. This was primarily due to aesthetic reasons; we failed to realize beforehand that Rome in general, despite its picturesque settings, is thousands of years old and looks like it. Cars are jammed packed together, trash dumpsters line the street right outside the hotel, and litter is quite prevalent. On top of that the hotel staff was NOT overly friendly and they did not come across as being dedicated to making sure our stay at their hotel was a top priority. The first room we were assigned reinforced our opinion that we (I) had selected the wrong hotel, especially for the pre-paid money we had put up. The carpet was worn, both seats of the chairs in the room were heavily stained and one had its fabric torn, and the walls were heavily marked with luggageg scrape marks. After complaining to the manager, he had a bellhop show us another room that was better (hardwood floors instead of carpet), but was still not up to what I would expect for a 4-star hotel. On the positive side, the bathrooms were great! I really appreciated the US electrical plug. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and its buffet was wide ranging, very good, and quite plentiful. We ate their every morning. We never ate lunch in the hotel, but we did eat dinner there once, and would never do it again. We paid the equivalent of $190+ dollars for dinner for 2, with a half carafe of wine. The food, its quality, and the service may have been worth half that much, and that is being generous. We ate dinner at a very nice restaurant across the river for about the same amount, and it was well worth the expense and the experience. By the way, we walked to and from the restaurant during numerous nightime escapades, and felt completely safe each time. All in all, for the rates we paid, and the service we received, I would be reluctant to stay at this hotel again, especially if it was to celebrate another milestone in our marriage. If I was on a business trip with business near The Vatican, I probably would stay here again. In either case, I would never eat dinner in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: uberleslie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon. Loved our room -- comfy bed, clean amenities, nice bathroom. Breakfast was a little disappointing, but it's Rome...there are a million other places to eat! Have read the reviews of unfriendly staff, but definitely didn't experience that! Front desk workers were friendly and funny -- had a great time overall! Just around the corner from the best hazelnut gelato in the universe!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jameshalesowen
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights at the michealangelo hotel in rome and recommend this hotel to anyone, our room was lovely sheets changed every day, which you do not get in a 5 star hotel!!!! we had a room with a balcony overlooking the dome of st peters, very nice a night with a bottle of wine. Breakfast plenty of choice and served from 7 till 10.30. - we are going again next year and will certainly book again at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweetcv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from August 7th-11TH. We were a group of eight people, including my aunt who is disabled. On arriving at the hotel the reception staff were rude and looked like they couldnt be bothered to talk to us. The rooms had dirty walls and the smell of drains occcured every time we flushed the toilet or took a shower. The breakfast was ok, however no variety to it, Cereals, scrambled eggs ( Very Greasy) and bacon, also had crossaints, jam etc. The location was excellent, close to st peters square and Vatican. I advised strongly that if you do stay at this hotel you avoid the nearby restaurants.... A total rip off and food was something i wouldn't even feed my dog. Altough the food and hotel were apalling i would return to Rome as it is Amazing BUT would not stay a this hotel. Even received very disgraceful looks from the Hotel staff as we wished them a goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “awful experience”
Reviews.Author: strange77
Reviews.Content: It is not a 4 star hotel at all. We had a terrible experience. The rooms have to be renovated, especially the bathroom. The lamp in our bathroom fell down and split all over the floor and bathroom was a mess. For gods sake we were not in the room at that time. The equipment needs to be changed - the shower worked poorly and the water couldn't be flushed properly. The towels and the shampoo were forgotten to be put in our room. The room was never cleaned up in time. And! You can never reach the reception staff on the phone - they just don't pick it up. When we went downstairs and explained our problems the staff were not helpful at all and argued (!!!) with us. With such a bad service, unprofessionalism and awful attitude I can hardly recommend this hotel neither to a friend nor to an enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Most Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Nonna Sicilia
Reviews.Content: After a Trafalger tour, we spent 3 days in Rome at the Starhotels Michelangelo. It is a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. The staff was always courteous and helpful. We made arrangements through the hotel for 2 daytime tours and were very pleased with them. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There were resturants nearby that were not expensive and taxi's were always available ourside the door. We needed transportation to the airport and the arrangements made through the hotel were resonable and reliable. We had a room on the front of the hotel with a view of the Vatican. At times the noise level was high, but not so much that it disturbed our sleep. The cost of the room was very resonable for its location. We had a comfortable king size bed, and the room was a nice size. I would very likely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service - great location”
Reviews.Author: DrKatieRN
Reviews.Content: Great location (next to the Vatican) and nice rooms. Service, however, was the poorest I'd ever experienced. The staff was rude and unresponsive. The staff wouldn't call a call, yelled and scolded at us when we asked to iron something, had poor security, and were downright mean. Their restaurant suggestions were high priced with fair food. Other guests had purses stolen during breakfast and the staff was unresponsive. They are expensive due to the location. I expected basic customer service, yet they treated guests as if they were "doing them a favor." If Starhotel executives read this, I urge you to change management there and implement a customer service program, such as that offered by the Ritz Carlton. They could even learns something from Super8 Motels! Only go there for the location. Bring your own security alarm for the room as they share the keys. Don't ask any questions! Katie, a very dissatisfied world traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: dancnval
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Starhotels Michelangelo from July 13-16. The only things going for this hotel are the location and the clean room. If you need anything else from the hotel, you're out of luck! The service from the reception desk was awful. Each time we asked the desk for something, the answer was, "No!". My family and I couldn't believe how rude the staff was at this hotel. They were completely unaccommodating. We stayed at other hotels in other cities throughout Italy, and we found this hotel to be the worst in customer relations. First of all, the hotel gives you a key on a key chain the weight of a small dumbbell and they encourage you to leave it with them at the desk when you leave. We asked them to supply a second key and they said, "No!". So each time we left the hotel, we left the key at the desk. FYI - there was no safe on the hotel rooms. Then when we returned to the hotel, we would ask for our room key from an entirely different set of staff and they would give it to us without asking to see any identification. I felt uneasy leaving the key and without having them check to see if we were really staying in the hotel. Anyone could ask for a key from the desk and get one. We asked to have an iron sent to our room and was rudely told, "No!". The hotel reception desk told us that it's against the law in Italy to have an iron in your room. We were unaware of this "law" because we had an iron sent to our rooms in other hotels we stayed at throughout Italy and was never told "no" or that is was against the law. Since we couldn't borrow an iron, we asked if there was an ironing service and we were told, "It's too late!" So the next day we asked for ironing service earlier in the day and was given a hard time by the reception desk once again. They looked at us like we were asking for something unheard of. We proceeded to wait as the reception desk called for the maid. After, they said we would have to wait one hour and that the cost is 12 Euros per piece! We said no thanks. We decided to wear wrinkled clothes. The "American breakfast buffet" was disgusting! The eggs were made of powder and looked fake as they were bright yellow in color. How hard is it to mess up powdered eggs? They were runny and made me feel nauseous when I ate them for the first time. The breads they served were a strange tasting croissants and a loaf of breads. The meat they served was greasy and undercooked. My husband, who has a bad stomach was sick after eating breakfast the first morning. After that, he ate bread with butter the next two days. I was hoping the coffee would be good, but I was disappointed again! The coffee was awful too! I opted to eat the cold cereal and drank the juice instead. The service at breakfast was lacking as well. There was a number of staff walking around the dining room, however not one of the staff members on the three mornings we were there, asked if everything was okay. The hotel was booked of people on a Globus tour. You will see the Globus tour people at breakfast if you go early enough. It seems that the Starhotels Michelangelo is more concerned with packing out there hotel with people rather than taking care of them. Do not ask the reception desk for recommendations for restaurants, they will guide you to expensive restaurants that have mediocre food. You are better off reading other people's trip reports. The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to focus your Rome trip on the Vatican. The room was clean and comfortable. Starhotels Michelangelo desperately needs to work on their service. I know we were in another country but I didn't think we were on a different planet. Starhotels Michelangelo had the worst service out of all the hotels we stayed in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: scienceteach14
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our first day it Italy. We arrived to the hotel very early, well before check-in, and they kindly put our bags in a locked closet for us to retrieve later. We then set out to explore the Vatican which is only a 5 to 6 minute walk. The room was perfect and the breakfast provided was quite a spread. We were told not to expect much for breakfast from Italian hotels but this one delivered and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Michelangelo Hotel Rome Italy: watch your belongings: thieves in dining room”
Reviews.Author: european_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Michelangelo Hotel in Rome Italy July 5th and 6th, 2007. Unfortunately we were robbed while having breakfast in the dining room of the hotel. When I reported this to the staff in the dining room, they did not seem to care at all. I then reported t his to the hotel management and with much reluctance they tried to assist me and admitted that there were thieves (high class, well dressed) posing as tourists who occassionally come to eat in their dining room - even though they were not staying in the hotel. Needless to say, being robbed of all your money, credit cards, personal documents etc, on your first day in Italy is enough to ruin your holiday .

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but management has bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhealy
Reviews.Content: This 4-star hotel is located on the edge of the Vatican City, a good base to explore the stunning Eternal City. Re the location, if you wish to head east towards the city centre proper, the quickest route is via a tunnel, but beware that this is an unpleasant walk (noisy, dark, atmosphere a bit menacing). You are probably best to take a longer route and go via the Vatican and take a metro or just get a taxi. Our room was nice and had been recently refurbished. However, the air con wasn't working and when we asked the manager to fix it, the attitude we received was just unbelievable. Apparently the management centrally controls when the air con operates, even though there are individual controls in the rooms. Our room was genuinely very stuffy, but the response was pretty much, "tough, open the windows if you're hot"! Now this would be OK if the hotel was a budget 2-star, but Michelangelo is a 4-star hotel and I felt this was downright rude and unacceptable. Breakfast was OK - the American-style buffet was a bit greasy and there was definitely an over-abundance of staff who seemed to be walking around doing very little. Overall, this place is OK if you get a decent rate. Otherwise, I would avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: cab33141
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel in May 2007, and found it entirely satisfactory. Its major asset from our viewpoint was its location- only a block or so from St. Peters Basilica. The Vatican museums and St Peters are incredibly crowded even in May, and it was great to be able to walk "next door" and access these tourist meccas early in the morning as they're opening. This meant that our wait in line was either negligible or non-existant.. The accomodations were clean and comfortable but not exactly plush. The front desk people were helpful and friendly in a measured and careful sort of way. The restaurant served entirely satisfactory but not extravagant food. We thought it was pretty expensive for the quality of food served. The morning breakfasts which were included in our package, on the other hand, were the best we saw in Italy in our opinion. We definitely will stay here gain on our next trip to Rome, and we recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Michelangelo”
Reviews.Author: mb2495
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Location was perfect for Vatican (4 blocks). Staff was very accomodating and room was very nice. Would definitely stay there if Vatican was tops on my list. Pretty easy walk to Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good - location great for st peters but not in centre”
Reviews.Author: penkiBristol
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good - room great but was at front of hotel so bit noisy. Just a couple of minutes from St Peters but you had to take a bus or walk 10 mins to the metro to get to any of the other sites e.g. spanish steps, trevi

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KarenLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the starhotel michelangelo around easter and were VERY disappointed. This hotel should never have been rated a 4 star! It is very dated and worn down and is in desperate need of a renovation! The restaurant is terrible and over priced!The only good point of this hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MMOuellette
Reviews.Content: HUGE ROOM... EXCELLENT, very clean, amazing balcony view of the vatican.... close to a few amazing restaurants... amazingly cheap chinese restaurant. Love the Candy left on our pillow. Can't rant and rave enough.. only thing u have to walk ..closest subway station about 10-20 min maybe - Weird thing is that the bed was two twin beds together...a europe thing !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, so close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Family_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) stayed here from 4/3 - 4/7 for 4 nights. Overall, we like our stay and will recommend to others. When we checked in, we were offered rooms on 4th and 7th floor. The 7th floor rooms are so much nicer, so it's an easy decision. Since we checked in with prepaid hotel voucher, there is really no incentive for the hotel to show/sell us the better rooms. We appreciate their offers! The 7th floor rooms (703 and 709) are very well decorated. The bath room are with marble/granite (or look like). It also comes with slipper, bathrobe, chocolate and a good selection of tea/coffee/cappucino/chocolate powder to make you own drinks (with an electric kettle to boil water). I will rate the room as 4 stars. However, there is one drawback. The rooms are warm with no air condition for this time of the year, so I often open the window. The front desk is nice but could be friendlier, part of it can be due to the language barrier. The staff speaks English but I do ask a lot of questions, so they get a little impatient. The breakfast was nice, with a big table with repeated selections on both end. We never encounter a line there even when the restaurant was filled with other guests. The easist way to get around town is to take the bus (46, 571, 916). Exit the hotel, turn left, make another left on the next block. It's less than 5 minute walk. On your way there, you pass a pastry store (BonCaffe?), you can get Gelato for 1 Europe. We enjoy that a lot! Also, buy a map with bus route (3 Euro). That will help you a lot knowing where to get on/off. All the major tourist spots are a short ride away (10-15 minutes). Be ready for the crowded bus though. The hotel is so close to St. Peters. It is within a 5-minute walk. take the same direction above, but make right after 1 block. There is a pedestrain underground walkway with sign. We walked to St. Peters multiple times because it is so close. Take some bread/cookies with you, you can feed the pigeons at St. Peters square. I had taken several photos with pigeons picking food from my wife's palm. There is also a Green Cafe diagonal across from the hotel. Nothing fancy but nice neighborhood atmosphere with good prices. It offers pastry, sandwiches, drink and the coffee/latte etc. One complaints about the Rome. We use a limo service with a counter right at the FCO Rome airport (with a sign stating they are official limo/transport). We got charge 90 on the way to the hotel and 35 back. We overpaid about 25 Euros when compare using the taxi. The Italian tourist desk at the airport is no help. You are supposed to be charged 40 Euro if you live with the "wall". This hotel is just outside the wall, so you should expect to pay just a little more. In fact, the hotel can arrange for transportation for 52/47 Euros (can't remember which way, one is to pick up, one is to drop off). 25 is nothing, but I hate to be taking advantage of. Make sure you take the taxi instead and avoid the limo service (unless you travel with more than 4).

Reviews.Title: “Location might be good but the rooms are horrible”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveller1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and I really can't recommend the hotel. The reception staff was unfriendly and our room was horrible. The room was located on the top floor and there were stains on the carpets and on the bed sheets and cracks all over the ceiling. The room we had was directly next to the lifts so it was almost impossible to sleep due to the constant noise of the lifts. It could be seen that our floor was being renovated while we were there as there were no carpets in the hallway and there were buckets of paint all over the place. Some of the other floors looked less messy but overall the hotel looked dated. Don't be fooled by the looks of the lobby which looks clean and modern. The hotel is in a central location which is the only good thing about the hotel. The breakfast was decent but nothing special. Overall the hotel is far too expensive considering the standard of the rooms. I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxz
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel as part of a package on Lastminute, using the 'secret hotel' option. Close to Vatican City. The rooms are basic, but clean. No kettle etc. Rooms at the front of the building are very noisy (windows are not double glazed). Bathroom was clean, but smelt suspiciously of blocked drains! Breakfast was included, and has everything you need. Staff at hotel were very helpful, and did not loitre for tips. If you want to eat out for dinner, expect a bit of a walk, as the best resturants are further afield. Have no complaint about the hotel, however decor is dated, and not really a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merrilyn-P
Reviews.Content: Having read recent Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel, I was not convinced that this hotel was the right choice for my mother, toddler and I. However, it was a last minute booking and I didn't have too many options! To be honest, I can't believe that the 18 September entry was even about this hotel! The Michelangelo exceeded my expectations. The staff were efficient, service-oriented and knowledgeable. We had requested a quiet room, with 3 beds and a bath and the room allocated gave us these with no problems. It was also very clean and I loved the 'pillow menu!' The breakfast was extensive. The location, just 200 metres from St Peter's was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was great value for money and no real hardship to get to the 'ancient centre' of Rome. 5 euros in a cab across the river if your weary feet protest!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewName123
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very good. The room was very clean and well appointed. The staff spoke English and was able to answer questions we had about Rome. Breakfast was very good with bacon, eggs, baked apples and an assortment of pastries, cereals, yogurts and fruits. It is very convenient to The Vatican and to the Metro. It is not in city center but we were able to walk to most places. You would probably want to use public transportation to get to the Colliseum. There is a small grocery store next door which was very good for picking up lunch items on the way out to sightsee. There were also numerous small cafes and pizzerias where we were able to get good food for reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you must be close to Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: crazy4nature
Reviews.Content: I travel to Italy on business three times a year and regularly use the Starhotel chain. They have good properties in Florence and Milan but this one was a great dissappointment. The only reason to consider this hotel is its proximity to Vatican City. The location is far from the city center and other attractions in Rome. The hotel is in desperate need of rennovation. The restaurant is terrible. The service is geared to group tours. The rooms are tiny and decrepit. Not a good choice in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Veriti
Reviews.Content: My husband, my teenage son and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Starhotels Michelangelo. We booked two rooms which we found were next door to each other - a great bonus for keeping an eye on our son :-) Rooms were adequate with fantastic air conditioning - a boon in 40 degree heat. Breakfasts were plentiful but don't go near the runny eggs, also bacon was swimming in grease. Usual cereals, fruit, yogurts and cakes etc. - all included in room price. Great location for Vatican - we never took the bus into other areas of Rome, preferring to take the easy option and get a taxi. Contrary to other reports there were plenty of cafes/non-fancy restaurants within walking distance which were more than suitable for our needs. On our last day Guiseppe on the front desk went out of his way to extend our check-out time as our flight was not till the evening and arranged a last tour of Rome sights by taxi at no extra cost before being dropped off at the airport. Absolutely outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for great money”
Reviews.Author: nes
Reviews.Content: Roma, Starhotel Michelangelo- two days ago I returned from Rome, hotel is very good option to stay in Rome. Room was great, very, very clean with all necessary items in it. Bath was clean with complimentory staff in it and a small tv inside. We were in 7 th floor and we did not have look at St. Peters church but it was not matter. Location of hotel is great, to Vatican you have 5 minutes light walking, and to Piazza Navona and other interest places on the other side you have to walk maximum 30 minutes. We also used nearby garage for 20 Eur per day. Everybody was so polite and helpful from garageboy, receptionists, cleaning lady..Very good choise!

Reviews.Title: “Off to a shaky start”
Reviews.Author: MRPOg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five days in Rome and had a wonderful time. Our family vacation included five adults and a toddler. At the time we made our reservations in April, we determined our only option was for us to reserve three rooms. We received confirmations on a suite and two rooms (one for two adults and one for one adult) for four nights. All of our rooms were reserved as non-smoking. Upon our check-in, we discovered one of our rooms (the single) was a smoking room. When we went back to the desk to tell them this is not what we had reserved, we were told the hotel was full and there was nothing that could be done. We inquired whether we could have a cot put in one of the other rooms since there was adequate space. The response was that we would still have to pay for the room. We were very disappointed that the inability to fulfill the reservation was not communicated to us on our confirmation. We were told however that we could have a different room beginning the second night. The next day we were given a room in which the air conditioning did not work. Not a good thing for late June in Rome. After a maintenance worker spent some time confirming that the air conditioning in fact did not work, we were given a third room which finally was what we expected. The hotel is in a great location – so close to St. Peter’s. The hotel staff was generally very helpful and assisted in calling taxis when we needed them. Very spacious rooms, especially the suite, with great bathrooms. Great variety of items at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..paying for convenience & location.”
Reviews.Author: smbooth1250
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not worth over 200. USD but the fact of the matter is you are paying for the close proximity of St. Peters/Vatican City. I recently returned from a stay at the hotel with a few friends and we were able to book a triple room. Which is difficult to find in the height of toursim season in Italy. The room was very lovely, clean, and roomie. The only down-side was there was no safe in our room, which made me alittle bit nervous. The hotel staff was friendly and recommended a great & affordable restaurant near te Spanish Steps. The breakfast is just OK, nothing terrific..I've had better and worse..it was somewhere in the middle. Take advantage of the airport shuttle (personal driver) for roughly 45 euro total. Its the best deal I was able to find. Its well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Michelangelo!!”
Reviews.Author: kis_cervino
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days in Rome and stayed at this hotel. I was afraid that the location would be inconvenient --- but I was wrong; it was very convenient. Close to St. Peter's, a short walk to the Metro (we didn't use the buses). It was also very quiet! Our room was just fine, we had one of the littlest rooms on our floor, but it was nothing to complain about. We also found it to be very clean, and I'm pretty particular. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I got sick while in Rome and the staff arranged a taxi for us and wrote the name of the hospital and gave it to the taxi driver. They were ready to let us stay longer if I needed to, thankfully I didn't need to, but it was comforting to know we'd still have a place to stay. The breakfasts were okay, there was a large selection of food (compared to the other hotel we stayed at), and you should be able to find something you like. You don't want to eat too much anyway, save your appetite for the great Italian food!!! The only negative thing I have to say is that the bar is expensive---they charged me $3.50 for a small bottle of water!!!!! Would I stay here again - you bettcha!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Woozle00
Reviews.Content: The title says it all really. The hotel's OK. Our room was usual size for a double, containing double bed (no!), wardrobe, Pay-TV, Minibar, Hair dryer. No safe. Shower but no bath. Reasonably quiet air-con, not bad condition, quite clean. Breakfast was standard euro fare. Small bar, open 'til 1 am. Terribly expensive. The location was excellent. A block away from St Peter's Basilica and the Vatican. These sites are the other side of the river from the rest of Rome, so it's quite quiet - and it doesn't suffer so much from the incessant drone of scooters. Rome itself is an easy walk across a choice of several bridges, plus there are very frequent, cheap buses from St Peter's Square to the Piazza Venezia/Colosseum, etc. Would we go back? To Rome? - of course! To the Michaelangelo maybe not. But if you've already booked it there's nothing to worry about, and if you want to spend lots of time at the Vatican/St Peter's it may be just the place.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough for me: Over-rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: monamia
Reviews.Content: Considering it all...location I liked, food was great (and the waiter staff), most of the desk attendants were superb (all of the women and a few of the men--Claudio was my favorite), but, I thought the room was dirty. I didn't want to walk on the rug with barefeet. The bathroom stank--literally, it smelled like a sewer, I covered the drain with the wastebasket and that helped.I should have reported it, but didn't want to lose one minute of Rome-time. This hotel would be deadly in the heat. My room was of good size, had a nice view, I got a peek of the peak of the dome of St. Peter's.
