I liked the area, and Fabrizio's souvenir shop nearby was the BEST. He helped me plan a few non-traditional excursions and had the best selection and price for religious souvenirs that I found. Great sense of humor and style. There is one of the world's great conditoris (sp?) with luscious desserts and beautiful cappuchinos around the corner. I learned the buses and subways and had an easy time getting around. (Avoid crowded travel times on buses and subways, and you will probably not be robbed if you are aware of your surroundings--just like any of the world's big cities.) A female travelling alone who's staying at this hotel should just face it, and plan to wait patiently until all the men at the desk with questions and requests are accommodated before getting male staff attention. Other experienced traveling ladies in a group I met in the hotel were unable to extend their stays since the hotel only offered them OUTRAGEOUS prices--$200 a night, just after I heard the desk people quote 65 eruos to a phone caller. Not nice. These were not troublesome guests. I also thought the local Internet service place was way too sleezy, I think easy, convenient Internet access is a must, and I am brave. Overall, this hotel was fairly mediocre and over-priced and it appeared to me that women traveling with men had a better experience. My opinion is that a sophisticated, experienced traveler (this does not mean "rich") will not be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Beware hotel pickpockets!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Michelangelo with a Peter's Way tour group, we were pleased to find a clean, pleasant, comfortable room; but our pleasure soon turned to disappointment. Shortly after arriving we went to the hotel dining room to share our first Italian meal with our fellow travelers. Peter's Way had scheduled our group of approximately 150 people on numerous flights and many of us had been traveling for 24 hours. We enjoyed the pasta, wine and fellowship, but upon returniing to our room my husband discovered that he did not have his wallet. He hurriedly returned downstairs to find it...meanwhile the front desk called to say that they had the wallet. Of course, the $300 in the wallet had disappeared. The dining room manager took my husband to the kitchen where he apparently questioned the staff about the wallet. Because the manager spoke in Italian, my husband had no idea what he was saying. The manager assured my husband that the hotel would take care of it and that the money would be returned...the next day the manager laughed it off when my husband asked about the money. We reported the theft to our Peter's Way representatives who indicated that they would discuss it wth hotel management. By the time we realized that neither Peter's Way nor hotel management would do anything to help us, it was too late to make a police report. We had been told by our guides to guard against pickpockets on the subway and in tourist areas, but we had no idea that the hotel staff would be picking pockets while serving our meals. If you choose to stay at this hotel, you would be wise to be on guard at all times...another friend had a camera stolen when he was sitting in the lobby. Also be aware that this hotel apparently books a lot of groups, which makes it very difficult to get breakfast when more than one group has been scheduled for an early morning tour.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great sightseeing location”
Reviews.Author: hazbaz
Reviews.Content: Nice location in a fairly quiet part of the city within a couple of minutes' walk of St. Peter's and the river. Bright, spacious rooms with hifi, robes, slippers etc. The fittings are not brand new but the rooms are very clean. There's not a spectacular view but with so much within walking distance that's not too important. The reception and restaurant staff are pleasant and helpful, we didn't use the bar. The restaurant was only average considering the price. Breakfast is fine and may as well be had in the hotel but if we went again we'd only eat out in the hundreds of eating places available. One piece of advice, the bus links from near (<300m) this hotel are very good. Learn how to use them, especially if you want to see the whole city. Although walking is great you will be very tired if you criss-cross the city several times in a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but get a better price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Starhotel Michelangelo in Rome. We enjoyed ourselves immensely but a few things to consider. The location to the Vatican is excellent (a 300 yard or so walk to the entrance), the staff were helpful and the breakfast was very good- alittle bit of everything to eat. Unfortunately, The computer in the entrance mentioned in their website does not exist. There is a hookup in the room, but I did not bring my laptop because it said they had the computer there for our use to email back home. We were there for a conference held in the hotel and made reservations in October. We got charged $210/night which was too much! This is a $120 to $130/night hotel at best. It was interesting that we got gouged as this website offers deals from $113/night now! It was comfortable, clean with decent sized rooms-just get it at a better price than I did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: daddymac1
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. It is in a quiet neighborhood, but bus is less than a block away. Very good breakfast, service is ok. The internet computer in lobby is very handy. The rooms are very nice, however the lower floors can be noisy. Ask for a room on the upper floors they have a better view and are more quiet. The bus will take you directly to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cbhicks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy. We were a family group that occupied several rooms at the Starhotels Michelangelo. The rooms were spacious and clean, and very quiet considering all the people that appeared to be staying there. Breakfast was good, and the location perfect for all the major sights. We were a bit disappointed in the front desk staff...many previous reviews praised their friendliness, and we did not find this to be completely accurate. They accommodated all of our requests, but at times it seemed to be a bother for them, even when no one else was at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Bluehill
Reviews.Content: This hotel did have plenty of good points. We liked the location near St Peters and the rooms were large (by Rome standards) and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was not exceptional but was OK and the staff were generally helpful, particularly in sorting out a taxi to get us to Fiumicino airport for 6:30 am. There was, however, one major disadvantage - a ventilation shaft in the ceiling of our bedroom which, if they were in a particular spot in their rooms, perfectly broadcast the voices of our neighbours into our bedroom. It wasn't a constant problem - if the people were elsewhere in their rooms you couldn't hear them at all, but we did have various interuptions at antisocial hours as a result of this, the low point of which was being woken at 3am by the sounds of a couple in one of the neighbouring rooms (we never did work out which) enjoying an extremely noisy "intimate moment". Would I stay there again? Well, even despite the noise issue there were enough good points to say maybe, but I would certainly check out the alternatives in detail before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: nordicgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many things going for it. The staff are helpful and polite. The decor is excellent. The hotel rooms are well above average and are comfortable. The cleanliness is well above average. I would recommend it to anyone. However, the food is appalling. The breakfast, although lavish, is let down by the hot dishes. The scrambled egg comprises a pool of liquid egg with lumps of solid egg in various states in it. Some of the egg is black, some of it is golden brown. Difficult as it would seem to achieve, this was the standard for each of the three days we looked at it. The bacon is either under or over done in a pool of grease. An evening meal comprised cold fried potatoes and deep fried burnt chicken - which was described as "roast" on the menu. It's a shame that such an exceptional hotel is let down by this appalling standard of cooking. I think it's time for the hotel to receive a mystery shopper from head office!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Staff Helpful, location great for Vatician, Good value for money for 4star hotel. Rooms clean, breakfast great. We had booked 14 rooms for a wedding in June. Not one of our travel companions could fault the hotel or staff. Some are even going back to stay again in the hotel this year. I was upgraded to a suite which are suitated on the top floor. Suites are slightly smaller than other rooms, but a very comfortable. If you have a room to the front of the hotel, you can see St Peters Dome. Would recommend this hotel to anyone for a break in Rome. Especially if you want to stay near the Vatican, as it is a very reasonly priced hotel for this area and it is a 4star.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ll127
Reviews.Content: This is as close to "American Standards" as you are going to get. This hotel is very spacious has a large breakfast area. The breakfast included eggs and bacon. The room was a nice size, had a minibar, and a balcony. Although the location is very close to the Vatican, it's pretty far from the rest of the sites. I walked about an hour to get to the Colosseum from here. I'm not very familiar with the neighborhoods in Rome, but this one seemed quite desolate and night and early mornings. Not much to do around here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel Near St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located, literally, a few blocks from the Vaticano. For this reason, it is imperative that you request a room with a balcony with a view of the Cuppola; I was initially shown a room with windows and no balcony and was not pleased. The staff are quite helpful and were willing to have me view a few rooms to meet my expectations. The rooms are quite large and very well air conditioned. The bathrooms are clean, as are the showers. The decor is quaint, bordered by yellow walls, and the beds are relatively comfortable. Be forewarned that if you are seeking a "typical Italian breakfast", you will be disappointed. Though there is a smorgasboard of plenty available to all clients in the breakfast room, the breakfast is sadly North American, with soggy eggs and pounds of bacon catering to the non-European palette. It would have been nice to have a more Roman breakfast, but quantity is certainly not lacking. If you are travelling with someone who has difficulty walking, also be forewarned that you will be exceptionally reliant upon taxi cabs; the closest Metro station is about a 1/2 hr. walk away, north of St. Peter's. In the heat, this distance can prove exceptionally trying. For those persons curious about where Romans purchase their groceries, a lovely supermarket called la "GS" exists about a twenty-minute walk away and is ripe with flavourful Italian fruits and cheeses. Overall, the hotel is worth staying at, provided you request a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Helpful Staff,Good Local Restaurant Nearby...”
Reviews.Author: Grandson88
Reviews.Content: The Michelangelo Hotel was perfect for our needs. We spent 13 nights (June 24-July 7)at the hotel and enjoyed the great breakfasts. What a variety of food. We were located on the second floor and the rooms were very nice. The maids cleaned very well. Great bathrooms, the air conditioned worked, and rooms was furnished well, and good pillows. We found the location a great asset. The Vatican is located 4 blocks away. You can avoid lines to the top of St Peters by going early in the morning. The Sistine Chapel and Museum can be visited in the afternoon to avoid waiting in line. The musem has a great cafeteria The entire staff was most helpful for all our needs. They also can gets you a taxi very quickly and also can get you trip to Sorrento or other destination through the Green Line Tours. Due to the location you can walk to the Paizza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and Trastevere. This is can be 2-3 mile walk. Two locale restaurants with air conditioning were our favorites and these were medium priced. PERDINCIBACCO AND CINSE YU QU LIN both located on Via della Fomaci 89 & 31/a-31/b. Excellent service. There are various stores in the area which takes a walk around the area to find what you need. We will be going back to Rome and will be staying at the Michelango Hotel soon.........enjoy a nice time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay away from the center of Rome, but what a terrific choice the Starhotel Michelangelo turned out to be for my 13-year-old nephew and I. I found that the price of this 4-star hotel was comparable to many 3-star hotels in the Pantheon area. As is true with most Eurpean hotels, the rooms are small. Ours was lovely, however, and had all of the expected amenities (hairdryer, mini-bar, etc.). With a bit of effort, I could see the dome of St. Peter's from my window. In fact, we walked to St. Peter's square each evening since it was only 3 blocks away (there is also a taxi stand in the square). Most surprising was the breakfast: Eggs, bacon and ham, wonderful cheeses and jams, cereals, and predictably marvelous bread. What a way to start our day! There is a great neighborhood restaurant (La Vittoria or Il Vittorio, I've forgotten which) that anyone staying here will enjoy. There is a bus stop two blocks away, and the number 7 gets you close to many popular tourist attractions. If I'm ever in Rome again, I'll head immediately to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice base for Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: MK_Cal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room and found the Starhotels Michelangelo a very nice base for our stay in Rome. The staff was very helpful, arranging transportation, and offering good suggestions for nearby restaurants. The room was on the larger size, by European standards, and we found the location quiet and restful. The building looks very dated on the outside but the interior has been updated and is kept in good order. The computer in the lobby was a huge benefit !! The cleaning staff needs a stronger vacum for cleaning the very low pile carpeting but that one issue did not detract from our stay at the hotel. It is near the Vatican and also near the 64 line so getting to other locations in Rome is easy. The days were 25-30 degrees C and the AC was able to keep the room very comfortable at night. Breakfast was more than sufficient and had much variety. We found that in general Italy does pasta well but morning breakfast sweets and breads are not the same quality as those in France! So in general don't expect the breakfast breads to be remarkable. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel & will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If good air conditioning is a must, then stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May/June 2005. the air conditioning worked fine during the day, but at nighttime both my husband and I awoke (every night) due to the heat (if felt like AT LEAST 80 F). Even by European standards, the air conditioning at night was poor. We switched to a different room, but that did not help. Other travelers we spoke with had the same problems at the same hours. When we talked with Hotel staff, they came into the room and told us the air conditioning was working and then left. The location is great. but if you are staying at a time when air conditioning is important-- then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 Starhotels on this trip and this was by far the worst. It was quite warm during our stay and even though the lobby was like a refridgerator, the rooms were HOT. We had 10 people in our party and all the rooms were like that. It's in a great location, but not a great hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “safe haven in rip off city”
Reviews.Author: Katherine24
Reviews.Content: Would reccommend this hotel to anyone. Staff were helpful and polite, breakfasts had good selection of hot and cold food. Such a short walk to the vatican is definately a plus and it only takes 20mins walk to centre of rome.Get a good map and walk to ancient rome you see more and really get the feel of this memorable city. Had a bad experience with the taxi from termini as we gave him a 50 euro note and he turned round and in a flash the 50 was a 10 this caused confusion and loss of money on our first hours in rome. The hotel booked a taxi for our return trip to the airport and it was only 47euro I would suggest you ring the hotel and ask for them to book a taxi for when you arrive they have a special deal with a company. Also watch the snack bars some charge 4euro for coffee, we got charged 6.80 euro for a danish and heard lots of rip off tales like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lesliedee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular. The friendly, helpful staff were eager to help direct us around the city. The rooms were neat and tidy with a New York modern flare. We couldn't of been any happier with the great location near Central Park, Time Square, and Rockerfeller Center. A perfect hotel for a quick city get away.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments!”
Reviews.Author: stefano
Reviews.Content: I couldn't disagree more with the previous review!! I stayed at the starhotel Michelangelo last month. The staff were excellent, very friendly and very helpful - nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were fine, very comfortable, I'd say. They certainly were not musty, as the previous reviewer mentioned and the heating system worked perfectly!! I shall be returning to Rome soon and I will be staying again at this hotel. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MrsPooks
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative reviews but did not heed the warning. This place is definetly not a 4 star hotel. It is a 2 star hotel. The heating didn't work, the rooms were musty and looked like a motel you'd find near a truck stop. Lots of spackle. I should say the breakfast was ok, but the place really needs a remodel. Staff is not too friendly, the bar is incredibly overpriced. If you stay there, be warned there are lots of pickpockets at the bus stop around the corner. If you want to stay at a great hotel, the StarHotel Anderson in Milan was 100% different than this one. It's more like a 5 star than a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: atlas750
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week during Christmas 2004. There are many excellent features about this hotel. It is in a very quite neighborhood, with many neighborhood amenities (markets, wine stores, pastry shop, etc.). The thing that drew me to the hotel is that it is one of few that offers full size/queen size beds instead of the all too common single beds found in medium priced Italian hotels. The room is a bit small by U.S. standards but adequate, all guest services and hotel staff were excellent. A nice surprise was the included full breakfast being available as room service for a 2.50 Euro surcharge. The only major issue I had with the hotel is that the carpet in the room needed cleaning badly, actually should be replaced, and that the room really needed a coat of paint due to scuffs, nicks, scrapes etc. The advertised "in room wireless internet" was absurdly priced at 22 Euros per day, and the TV based service through the hotel was about .25 Euros per minute. The hotel did however provide a free computer and printer with 24 hour access for the use of guests in the lobby. The location was great for St. Peters, but was an average 7 Euro taxi ride from most of the "tourist" spots. All things considered a reasonably priced hotel, with great service than needs a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “Super value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: FairbanksSwindon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I could not fault anything at this delightful hotel - the welcome, genuine hospitality, friendliness and helpful staff were truly refreshing. It's location is so convenient for St. Peter's Basilica - a mere 10 minute stroll away. Our room (#704) on the top (7th) floor was spotless and very peaceful - we thought we were the only guests. The breakfast selection, in the precision run restaurant, was enormous - more than enough to satisfy the heartiest of appetites. The courteous Reception staff were always keen to assist and advise, particularly Roberto and Alessandra, questions about coach tours, taxis, private hire cars, local buses, sightseeing, shopping, etc were all handled expertly. Period of stay: 14th - 17th October, 2004.

HotelInfo.Name: Starhotels Michelangelo
HotelInfo.Address: Via della Stazione di S. Pietro 14, 00165 Rome, Italy
